lines.value: the jd is listed among other doctorate degrees
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there is currently some debate in the architectural community to rename the degree to a doctorate in the manner that was done for the law degree decades ago
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is important to recognize that first professional degrees in these fields are different from researchoriented degrees and comparisons to the phd are problematic
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in some countries such as australia a diploma is a specific academic award in addition to that of bachelor/master's/doctorate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: diplomas are usually signified by a stole rather than an academic hood the latter being used only for those of graduate status
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a person with a diploma is termed a diplomate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: australia has several different kinds of diplomas diplomas advanced diplomas graduate diplomas and postgraduate diplomas
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the system is not without anomalies due largely to the different traditions of individual institutions which the australian qualifications framework aims to regularise
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a diploma is usually equivalent to the first year of a bachelor's degree although a few have been similar to bachelor of arts degrees and permit direct admission to graduate programs
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an australian advanced diploma is usually considered lower than a bachelor degree but may qualify its holder for advanced placement in a bachelor program direct admission to a graduate diploma course or albeit rarely direct admission to a master's program
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: graduate diplomas are always higher than a bachelor degree and usually require one year of full time study
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are often an additional course taken after a standard bachelor degree to introduce a specialization in a particular field or a new discipline
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example australian school teachers often study for a bachelor's degree in arts or science then in an additional year complete requirements for a graduate diploma of education which qualifies them as school teachers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some graduate diplomas are simply the first two semesters of a three or four semester master's program
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the past the graduate diploma of education was called the diploma of education some universities have issued postgraduate diplomas which are always in the same discipline as the undergraduate degree and generally no different from a bachelor with honours degree which requires one year after a regular bachelor degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: arts referring to the performing arts and literature the corresponding degree are bachelor of arts(ba and its masters is called master of arts(ma).management degrees are also classified under arts but is now a days considered a major new stream bachelor of business administration bba and masters of business administration mba
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: science referring to the basic sciences and natural science(biology physics chemistry etc the corresponding degree are bachelor of science(bsc and its masters is called master of science(msc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: engineering the engineering degrees in india follow two common patterns
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: bachelor of engineering(be and bachelor of technology(b.tech both representing a bachelors degree in engineering.the main difference being be is knowledge oriented(theoretical work and b.tech is skill oriented(practical work
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: similarly master of engineering(me and master of technology(m.tech
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in europe degrees are being harmonized through the bologna process which is based on the three level hierarchy of degrees bachelor licence in france master and doctor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this system is gradually replacing the two stage system now in use in some countries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this system is also currently in use in australia belgium canada new zealand portugal sweden norway the netherlands united kingdom serbia and croatia
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in austria there are currently two parallel systems of academic degrees
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in french universities the academic degree system was quite complicated the first degree was the baccalaureat completed in fact after high school then the two year diplome d'etudes universitaires generales ( deug general academic studies degree or premier cycle undergraduate education then the one year licence the one year maitrise master's degree the two forming the second cycle graduate education the 1-2 years diplome d'etudes approfondies special studies degree and the three year doctorate the two forming the troisieme cycle postgraduate education
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: with the bologna process the system is now much simpler baccalaureat a-level degree licence = bachelor master a new two year degree merging maitrise and dea and doctorate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this system is called lmd system in france which means licence master doctorat
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: traditionally in germany students graduated after four to six years either with a magister artium abbreviated m.a degree in social sciences humanities linguistics and the arts or with a diplom degree in natural sciences economics business administration and engineering
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: those degrees were the first and at the same time highest non phd/doctorate title in many disciplines before its gradual replacement by other anglo saxon inspired degrees
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: from the level of academic study a magister or diplom has to be considered equivalent to a master's degree and marks the end of four to six years of studying with the writing of a final thesis similar to a master's thesis
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a special kind of examination is the staatsexamen
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is not an academic degree but a government licensing examination that future doctors teachers lawyers solicitors judges public prosecutors patent attorneys and pharmacists have to pass in order to be eligible to work in their profession
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: students usually study at university for 4-6 years before they take the first staatsexamen
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: afterwards teachers and jurists go on to work in their future jobs for two years before they are able to take the second staatsexamen which tests their practical abilities in their jobs
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the first staatsexamen is at a level which is equivalent to a m.sc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: or ma since 1999 the traditional degrees are gradually being replaced by bachelor's bakkalaureus and master's master degrees see bologna process
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the main reasons for this change are to make degrees internationally comparable and to introduce degrees to the german system which take less time to complete german students typically take five years or more to earn a magister or diplom
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some universities are still resistant to this change considering it a displacement of a venerable tradition for the pure sake of globalization
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: universities must fulfill the new standard by the end of 2007
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the future the diplom or magister degree will no longer be awarded
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: doctorates are issued under a variety of names depending on the faculty e.g doktor der naturwissenschaften doctor of natural science doktor der rechtswissenschaften doctor of law doktor der medizinischen wissenschaft doctor of medicine doktor der philosophie doctor of philosophy to name just a few
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: multiple doctorates and honorary doctorates are often listed and even used in forms of address in german speaking countries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a diplom from a universitat magister master's or staatsexamen student can proceed to a doctorate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the doctoral promotion e.g to dr.rer
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: nat dr.phil
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: and others is equivalent to a phd degree and is therefore the highest academic degree to earn
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the doctorate's degree dr.med
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for medical doctors has to be considered as different medical students predominantly write their doctoral theses straight after they have completed studies like other students in other disciplines have to write a diplom magister or master's thesis
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: sometimes incorrectly regarded as a degree the habilitation is an academic qualification in germany and austria that allows further teaching and research endorsement after a doctorate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is earned by writing a second thesis the habilitationsschrift or presenting a portfolio of first author publications in an advanced topic
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the exact requirements for satisfying a habilitation depend on individual universities
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the habil as it is abbreviated to represent that a habilitation has been awarded after the doctorate was traditionally the conventional qualification for serving at least as a privatdozent e.g pd dr habil lecturer in an academic professorship now called w2 and w3
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some german universities no longer require the habilitation although preference may still be given to applicants who have this credential for academic posts in the more traditional fields
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in ireland a national diploma is below the standard of the honours bachelor degree whilst the higher diploma is taken after the bachelor degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the new nqai national framework of qualifications adopted in 2003 replaced the national dipoma with the ordinary bachelors degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the framework also clarifies that although the higher diploma is taken after the bachelor degree the learning outcomes are at the same level as for the honours bachelors degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more technically a diploma is a document attesting that its bearer has satisfied certain study requirements as opposed to a degree being a status level in the academic community
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for this reason diplomas are awarded to the recipient while degrees are conferred upon the graduand who then becomes a graduate or the graduand is admitted to a degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: similarly a person has a diploma but a graduate is in a status
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is also for this reason that study for diplomas can be at undergraduate or advanced level
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in italy access to university is possible after gaining the high school degree called diploma di maturita which is obtained at 19 years after 5 years of study in a particular high school focused on a certain subject e.g liceo classico focus on classical subjects and includes ancient greek and latin liceo scientifico focus on scientific subjects but includes latin and literature liceo linguistico for languages istituto tecnico for technics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: after the diploma one can enter university choosing any faculty e.g physics medicine chemistry engineering architecture there is no requirement to complete a specific high school in order to access a particular faculty but most of the university program test to select students
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: almost all faculties nowadays offers two academic degrees
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a first degree called laurea triennale is obtained after 3 years of study and a short thesis on one subject
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the second degree called laurea specialistica/magistrale ls/lm can be obtained proceeding with usually two additional years of study and specializing in a particular branch of the chosen subject e.g particle physics nuclear engineering etc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the laurea magistrale is obtained after the discussion of a thesis which usually involves some academic research or an internship in a private company
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: only few students continue their university career after passing a public selection to 3 further years of dottorato di ricerca equivalent to a ph
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: d mainly devoted to research with some compulsory courses the degree is also obtained after the discussion of a thesis on the results of the research done
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: alternatively after obtaining the laurea triennale and the laurea magistrale one can attend a so called master first-level master after the laurea triennale second level master after the laurea magistrale offered by universities and private organisations with a variety of subjects lengths and prices one year of master in italy can cost more than the fees paid for the entire preceding university education usually including a final internship in a company
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the netherlands the structure of academic studies was altered significantly in 1982
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in this year the twee fase structuur two phase structure was introduced by the dutch minister of education minister wim deetman
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: with this two phase structure an attempt was made to standardise all the different studies and structure them to an identical timetable
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: additional effect was that students would be persuaded stringently to produce results within a preset timeframe or otherwise discontinue their studies
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the two phase structure is still in effect today and is in line with the bologna process
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in order for a dutch student to get access to a university education he/ she has to complete the appropriate pre university secondary education voorbereidend wetenschappelijk onderwijs vwo gymnasium atheneum 6 years
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are other routes possible but only if the end level of the applicant is comparable to the vwo levels access to university education is granted
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for some studies specific end levels or disciplines are required e.g graduating without physics biology and chemistry will make it impossible to follow an academic medicine study
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for some studies in the netherlands a governmental determined limited access is in place
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this is a limitation of the number of applicants to a specific study thus trying to control the eventual number of graduates
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the most renowned studies for their numerus clausus are the medicine and dentistry
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: every year a combination of good pre university secondary education grades luck and some additional conditions determine who can start such a numerus clausus study and who can not
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a study location and/ or university to graduate from are appointed and are not subject to free choice
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in practice it is only possible on very exclusive grounds e.g family history connected to a certain university and seldom granted
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example all the members of the dutch royal family studied at leiden university due to the historic ties between the dutch royal family and this university
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: almost all dutch universities are government supported universities with only very few privately owned universities in existence i.e one in business and all others in theology
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: leiden university is the oldest founded in 1575
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: before the netherlands existed out of loose provinces i.e the low countries which were occupied and ruled by other powers like spain
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the occupying monarchs did not encourage education at or allowed the foundation of a university locally and preferred moulding educated people at their own institutions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: therefore marking the victory on the spanish willem van oranje william of orange william the silent underlined the founding of the dutch republic nowadays the netherlands belgium and luxembourg by granting leiden rights to found its own local university
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as mentioned before all university studies in the netherlands have in principle the same length four years and exist out of two phases nowadays many dutch universities offer specific msc studies thus integrating into and merging with the international scientific community
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in addition on many dutch universities lessons hoor colleges or complete curricula are conducted in english in stead of dutch
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: after successfully obtaining a drs or msc degree the student has the opportunity to follow a phd study to eventually obtain a doctorate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these too are structured ideally according to a pre set time schedule of 4 to 6 years
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: during these 4-6 years the phd student has to be mentored by a professor or more common multiple professors
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the phd study has to be concluded with at least a scientific thesis that has to be defended to a gathering of his/ her peers in practice the board of the faculty with guest professors from other faculties and/ or universities added
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more and more common practice nowadays and in some disciplines even mandatory is that during the phd study the student writes and submits scientific publications to peer reviewed journals that eventually need to be accepted for publication
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: although the number of publications is often debated and varies considerably a minimum of four one per year of phd study is quite accepted in the field of the exact sciences physics chemistry technology and medicine
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: after successful conclusion of a phd study the student is allowed the title of doctor abbreviated as dr
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this is similar for all dutch phd graduates
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the discipline in which the phd is obtained is not specifically noted
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: hence for example a phd in law medicine or mathematics all put the same abbreviation in front of their name e.g dr jansen
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as with the doctorandus degree nothing is noted behind the name of the phd to specify the discipline
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: stacking of titles as seen in other countries like for example germany prof dr dr dr musterfrau is highly uncommon in the netherlands and not well received
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: phd graduates or doctor"s can proceed to teach at universities as universitair docent ud - assistant professor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: with time experience and/ or achievement this can evolve to a position as universitair hoofd docent uhd - associate professor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: officially an uhd still works under the supervision of a hoog leraar the head of the department and commonly a professor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the position of hoog leraar is the highest possible scientific position at a university and equal to the us full professor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the netherlands the title of professor noted as prof jansen or professor jansen is connected to ones function
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in practice professors are head of a scientific department of a university faculty
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however this is not a given it is also possible that a department is headed by a plain phd based on knowledge achievement and expertise
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: officially it is not possible to use the title professor if not connected to a university
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: should a professor decide to leave the university thus he or she also loses the privilege to use the title of professor
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in practice however different customs are observed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: rule of thumb however is that retired professors often still note the title in front of their name where as people still active switch to a non university job must switch from the professor title to the phd or dr abbreviation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: contrary to some other european countries in the netherlands academic titles are rarely used outside of academia and are not listed on official documentation e.g passport and drivers licence as for example in germany
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: dutch academic titles however are legally protected and can only be used by graduates from dutch institutions of higher education
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: illegal use is considered an offence and subject to legal prosecution
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: holders of foreign degrees therefore need special permission before being able to use a dutch title
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: article 7.23 of the dutch higher education act provides the informatie beheer groep with the possibility to grant such a permission
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: prior to 2003 there were around 50 different degrees and corresponding education programs within the norwegian higher education system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in 2003 a reform was instituted to replace this older system with an international system for example many degrees had titles that included the latin term candidatus candidata
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the second part of the title usually consisted of a latin word corresponding to the profession or training
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these degrees were all retired in 2003
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the reform of higher education in norway kvalitetsreformen the quality reform was passed in the norwegian parliament the stortinget in 2001 and carried out during the 2003/2004 academic year
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it introduced standard periods of study and the titles master and bachelor baccalaureus
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the system differentiates between a free master's degree and a master's degree in technology
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the latter corresponds to the former sivilingenior degree not to be confused with a degree in civil engineering which is but one of many degrees linked to the title sivilingenior which is still in use for new graduates who can chose to also use the old title
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: all pre 2001 doctoral degree titles were replaced with the title philosophical doctor degree written philosophia doctor instead of the traditional doctor philosophia
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the title dr philos
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: is a substantially higher degree than the phd and is reserved for those who qualify for such a degree without participating in an organized doctoral degree program
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in poland the system is similar to the german one
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for instance warsaw university confers the following university degrees and titles
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in රුසියාව ukraine and some other former ussr republics they strongly distinguish educational kinds of academic degrees and real academic degrees connected with scientific researches
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the educational degrees are awarded after finishing college education
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are several levels of education one must choose between 2nd and 3rd year usually on the 3rd year of study
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: specialist and bachelor degree require taking final state exams and written work on practical application of studied skills or research thesis usually 50-70 pages and is roughly equivalent to master's degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: first level academic degree is called candidate of sciences say candidate of physical mathematical sciences or candidate of engineering sciences candidate of historical sciences etc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this degree requires extensive research efforts taking some classes publications in peer reviewed academic journals usually 5 publications suffice and writing in depth thesis 80-200 pages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: special scientific council of notable specialists in the field then reviews the thesis the written opinions of several outside referees and upon approval recommends the thesis for defense
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: upon open defense in front of the same council the members of the council vote it takes dominant majority 2/3 to pass and then a chair writes a statement on recommending to award the degree candidate of sciences to the defendant
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: all paperwork including thesis is then sent to so called highest attestation commission which upon review makes final approval and then issues the diploma of candidate of science
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the candidate of sciences degree is roughly equivalent to us phd degree although it requires longer research efforts more publications actually in us publications are not required for phd degree wider exposure and larger peer pool to pass
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: finally there is a doctor of sciences doktor nauk degree in russia and some former ussr academic environment
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this degree is sought after by established scientists who made discovery level contributions into certain field formally who established new direction or new field in science
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it requires discovery of new phenomenon or development of new theory or essential development of new direction etc this usually takes a decade or two of hard work after receiving candidate of sciences degree an extensive list of publications in peer reviewed academic journals usually ~50-300+ papers publishing a few monographs extensive participation in various panels and peers journals conferences grant award panels etc and establishing a school of candidates of sciences under own supervision so at least a few of your students have received candidacy degrees working with you on your discovery or in your new field direction
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it requires writing a deep and advanced thesis usually 300-800 pages and defending it in front of special council of prominent scientists in the field or in adjacent fields if the field discovery is completely new in a similar to candidate of sciences defense manner
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: upon voting all paperwork is again sent to the highest attestation commission which upon approval awards the diploma of doctor of sciences
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there is no equivalent of this doctor of sciences degree in us academic system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is roughly equivalent to habilitation in germany france austria and some other european countries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: before the bologna process the are diplom bachelor degree for 3 year and licenciado for 5 year but after it has changed to grado for all universitaries except for medical and architecture that will be directly master still under discussion if they can certify min 5 years professional experience ) and master to the ones who make later the postgrade master courses 60 to 120 ects credits in one or two years and doctor if you continue studies
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: very important must look to make official master with etcs credit because some university are making their own masters without this etcs credits out of the bologna process but this lastones are only like the diploma http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/diploma sept 08
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: also see differences between diplom and diploma
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: before the bologna process because there are three official languages in switzerland german french and italian the universities degrees were different depending on the language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in french speaking universities the first academic degree was the licence 4 to 5 years of study equivalent to the master's degree in the uk or the usa
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the postgraduate degree was the diplome d'etudes approfondies dea or dess 1-2 years of study equivalent to the master of advanced studies degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the swiss german universities the first degree was called lizentiat a 4-year degree and the second was the diplom nach dem ersten akademischen grad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the italian speaking university the first degree was called licenza a 4-year degree the second was the post laurea which took 1-2 years
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the doctoral's degree is the last stage at all the universities it requires 3-5 years depending on the field
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this subsection is for an image on the right hand side
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for information see subsection russian ukraine and some other former ussr republics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: මහා බ්‍රිතාන්‍ය තුල ප්‍රථම උපාධිය වසර තුනක අධ්‍යන කාලයකට අයත්වේ.කලා උපාධිය ( ba ) ඉංජිනේරු උපාධිය(beng සහ විද්‍යා උපාධිය(bsc මේ ගණයට අයත්ය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some students study an integrated master's which is still a first degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this takes four years of study and is usually designated by the subject such as meng for engineering mphys for physics mmath for mathematics and so on
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: grades are as above
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the 4-year meng degree in particular has now become the standard first degree in engineering in the top uk universities replacing the older 3-year beng
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: unlike the case in the united states due to earlier specialisation in education master's degrees may take only one year of full time study and the usual amount of time spent working for a phd is three years full time
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: therefore whilst the usual amount of time spent studying from bachelors level through to doctorate in the united states is nine years it is in most cases only seven in the united kingdom and may be just six since a master's degree is not always a precondition for embarking on a phd.recently there has been a significant rise in the number of courses offering postgraduate diplomas often in very specific vocationally related subjects
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: many institutions eg the open university offer these courses over one year with an additional year or two required for the award of a master's
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the popularity of these courses is in part due to legislative requirements to demonstrate managerial competence in public sector related functions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a foundation degree can be awarded for having completed two years of study in what is usually a vocational discipline
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the foundation degree is comparable to an associate's degree in the united states and can be awarded by a university or college of higher education
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the standard first degree in ස්කොට්ලන්තය is either a master of arts which only awarded by the ancient universities of scotland whereas a bachelor of arts is awarded by all other modern institutions for arts and humanities subjects or a bachelor of science for natural and social science subjects
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these can either be studied at general or honours levels
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a general degree ma or bsc takes three years to complete an honours degree ma hons or bsc hons takes four years to complete
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the general degree is not in a specific subject but involves study across a range of subjects within the relevant faculty
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the honours degree involves two years of study at a sub honours level in which a range of subjects within the relevant faculty are studied and then two years of study at honours level which is specialised in a single field for example classics history chemistry biology etc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this also reflects the broader scope of the final years of scottish secondary education where traditionally five highers are studied compared to typically three english or welsh a levels
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the higher is a one year qualification as opposed to the two years of a levels which accounts for scottish honours degrees being a year longer than those in england
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: advanced highers add an optional final year of secondary education bringing students up to the level of their a level counterparts students with strong a levels or advanced highers may be offered entry directly into the second year at scottish universities
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: honours for ma or bsc are classified into three classes postgraduate master's degrees may be offered in some subjects however unlike england and wales these are not designated master of arts as this is an undergraduate degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: postgraduate degrees in arts and humanities subjects are usually designated master of letters mlitt in natural and social sciences as master of science msc
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: non doctoral postgraduate research degrees are usually designated master of philosophy mphil or master of research mres
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: first doctoral research degrees in arts science and humanities subjects are usually designated doctor of philosophy phd
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ටෙක්සාස් ලුසියානා අකන්සාස් ප්‍රාන්තවල සිදුකෙරුණු අති විශාල භූමි පරීක්ෂාවන් මගින් ගගනගාමීන්ගේ ශේෂයන් හා ෂටල සුන්බුන් විශාල ප්‍රමාණයක් සොයා ගන්නා ලදී.කොළොම්බියානු හදිසි අනතුරු පරීක්ෂා කිරීමේ මණ්ඩලය columbia accident investigation board විසින් නිකුත් කරන ලද නිර්දේශයන් තාක්ෂණික හා සංවිධානාත්මක යන අංශ දෙකටම බලපෑවේය

lines.value: මෙයට සමගාමීව අන්තර්ජාතික අභ්‍යවකාශ මධ්‍යස්ථානයේ ගොඩනැගීම් කටයුතුවලට ද නැවතීමේ තිත තැබුණු අතර එයට sts - 114 තෙක් රුසියානු ෆෙඩරල් අභ්‍යාවකාශ ඒජන්සිය මත ගගනගාමීන් මාරුකිරීම හා ද්‍රව්‍ය සැපයීම සම්පූර්ණයෙන්ම රඳා පැවතිණි

lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: united kingdom lottery sports fund
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a writing system is a type of symbolic system used to represent elements or statements expressible in language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: writing systems are distinguished from other possible symbolic communication systems in that one must usually understand something of the associated spoken language to comprehend the text
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: by contrast other possible symbolic systems such as information signs painting maps and mathematics often do not require prior knowledge of a spoken language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: every human community possesses language a feature regarded by many as an innate and defining condition of mankind
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however the development of writing systems and the process by which they have supplanted traditional oral systems of communication has been sporadic uneven and slow
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: once established writing systems on the whole change more slowly than their spoken counterparts and often preserve features and expressions which are no longer current in the spoken language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the great benefit of writing systems is their ability to maintain a persistent record of information expressed in a language which can be retrieved independently of the initial act of formulation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: all writing systems require
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the study of writing systems has developed along partially independent lines in the examination of individual scripts and as such the terminology employed differs somewhat from field to field
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the generic term text may be used to refer to an individual product of a writing system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the act of composing a text may be referred to as writing and the act of interpreting the text as reading
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the study of writing systems orthography refers to the method and rules of observed writing structure literal meaning correct writing and in particular for alphabetic systems includes the concept of spelling
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a grapheme is the technical term coined to refer to the specific base or atomic units of a given writing system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: graphemes are the minimally significant elements which taken together comprise the set of building blocks out of which texts of a given writing system may be constructed along with rules of correspondence and use
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the concept is similar to that of the phoneme used in the study of spoken languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example in the latin based writing system of standard contemporary english examples of graphemes include the majuscule and minuscule forms of the twenty six letters of the alphabet corresponding to various phonemes marks of punctuation mostly non phonemic and a few other symbols such as those for numerals logograms for numbers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: note that an individual grapheme may be represented in a wide variety of ways where each variation is visually distinct in some regard but all are interpreted as representing the same grapheme
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these individual variations are known as allographs of a grapheme compare with the term allophone used in linguistic study
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example the minuscule letter a has different allographs when written as a cursive block or typed letter
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the selection between different allographs may be influenced by the medium used the writing instrument the stylistic choice of the writer and the largely unconscious features of an individual's handwriting
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the terms glyph sign and character are sometimes used to refer to a grapheme
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: common usage varies from discipline to discipline compare cuneiform sign maya glyph chinese character
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the glyphs of most writing systems are made up of lines or strokes and are therefore called linear but there are glyphs in non linear writing systems made up of other types of marks such as cuneiform and braille
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: writing systems are conceptual systems as are the languages to which they refer
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: writing systems may be regarded as complete according to the extent to which they are able to represent all that may be expressed in the spoken language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: writing systems were preceded by proto writing systems of ideographic and or early mnemonic symbols
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the best known examples are though the ge'ez writing system of ethiopia is considered semitic it is likely of semi independent origin having roots in the meroitic sudanese ideogram system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the chinese script likely developed independently of the middle eastern scripts around 1600 bc the pre columbian mesoamerican writing systems including among others olmec and maya scripts are also generally believed to have had independent origins
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is thought that the first true alphabetic writing appeared around 2000 bc as a representation of language developed for semitic slaves in egypt by egyptians see history of the alphabet
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: most other alphabets in the world today either descended from this one innovation many via the phoenician alphabet or were directly inspired by its design
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the oldest known forms of writing were primarily logographic in nature based on pictographic and ideographic elements
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: most writing systems can be broadly divided into three categories logographic syllabic and alphabetic or segmental however all three may be found in any given writing system in varying proportions often making it difficult to categorise a system uniquely
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the term complex system is sometimes used to describe those where the admixture makes classification problematic
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a logogram is a single written character which represents a complete grammatical word
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: most chinese characters are classified as logograms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as each character represents a single word or more precisely a morpheme many logograms are required to write all the words of language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the vast array of logograms and the memorization of what they mean are the major disadvantage of the logographic systems over alphabetic systems
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however since the meaning is inherent to the symbol the same logographic system can theoretically be used to represent different languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in practice this is only true for closely related languages like the chinese languages as syntactical constraints reduce the portability of a given logographic system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: japanese uses chinese logograms extensively in its writing systems with most of the symbols carrying the same or similar meanings
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however the semantics and especially the grammar are different enough that a long chinese text is not readily understandable to a japanese reader without any knowledge of basic chinese grammar though short and concise phrases such as those on signs and newspaper headlines are much easier to comprehend
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: while most languages do not use wholly logographic writing systems many languages use some logograms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a good example of modern western logograms are the hindu arabic numerals &mdash everyone who uses those symbols understands what 1 means whether he or she calls it one eins uno yi ichi or ehad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: other western logograms include the ampersand & used for and the at sign @, used in many contexts for at the percent sign % and the many signs representing units of currency $ c € £ ¥ and so on logograms are sometimes called ideograms a word that refers to symbols which graphically represent abstract ideas but linguists avoid this use as chinese characters are often semantic–phonetic compounds symbols which include an element that represents the meaning and element that represents the pronunciation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some nonlinguists distinguish between lexigraphy and ideography where symbols in lexigraphies represent words and symbols in ideographies represent words or morphemes
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the most important and to a degree the only surviving modern logographic writing system is the chinese one whose characters are or were used with varying degrees of modification in chinese japanese korean vietnamese and other east asian languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ancient egyptian hieroglyphs and the mayan writing system are also systems with certain logographic features although they have marked phonetic features as well and are no longer in current use
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as logographic writing systems use a single symbol for an entire word a syllabary is a set of written symbols that represent or approximate syllables which make up words
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a symbol in a syllabary typically represents a consonant sound followed by a vowel sound or just a vowel alone
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in a true syllabary there is no systematic graphic similarity between phonetically related characters though some do have graphic similarity for the vowels
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: that is the characters for ke ka and ko have no similarity to indicate their common k ness
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however another type of syllabic writing system is known as the abugida where each grapheme typically represents a syllable but where the characters representing related sounds are similar graphically typically a common consonantal base is annotated in a more or less consistent manner to represent the vowel in the syllable
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the nomenclature used to make this distinction was only introduced by linguists relatively recently borrowing the term abugida from ethiopian languages that call their own ge'ez script by this name
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: syllabaries are best suited to languages with relatively simple syllable structure such as japanese
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the english language on the other hand allows complex syllable structures with a relatively large inventory of vowels and complex consonant clusters making it cumbersome to write english words with a syllabary
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: to write english using a syllabary every possible syllable in english would have to have a separate symbol and whereas the number of possible syllables in japanese is no more than about fifty to sixty in english there are many thousands
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: other languages that use true syllabaries include mycenaean greek linear b and native american languages such as cherokee
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: several languages of the ancient near east used forms of cuneiform which is a syllabary with some non syllabic elements
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an alphabet is a small set of letters &mdash basic written symbols &mdash each of which roughly represents or represented historically a phoneme of a spoken language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the word alphabet is derived from alpha and beta the first two symbols of the greek alphabet
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in a perfectly phonemic alphabet the phonemes and letters would correspond perfectly in two directions a writer could predict the spelling of a word given its pronunciation and a speaker could predict the pronunciation of a word given its spelling
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: each language has general rules that govern the association between letters and phonemes but depending on the language these rules may or may not be consistently followed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: perfectly phonemic alphabets are very easy to use and learn and languages that have them for example serbocroatian or finnish have much lower barriers to literacy than languages such as english which has a very complex and irregular spelling system
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as languages often evolve independently of their writing systems and writing systems have been borrowed for languages for which they were not designed the degree to which letters of an alphabet correspond to phonemes of a language varies greatly from one language to another and even within a single language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in modern times when linguists invent a writing system for a language that didn't previously have one the goal is usually to develop a phonemic alphabet
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it should be noted that a truly phonetic alphabet for a natural spoken language would be very cumbersome as it would have to have a huge variety of phonetic variation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an example of such a writing system is the international phonetic alphabet ipa
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the first type of alphabet that was developed was the abjad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an abjad is an alphabetic writing system where there is one symbol per consonant
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: abjads differ from other alphabets in that they have characters only for consonantal sounds
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: vowels are not usually marked in abjad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: all known abjads except maybe tifinagh belong to the semitic family of scripts and derive from the original northern linear abjad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the reason for this is that semitic languages and the related berber languages have a morphemic structure which makes the denotation of vowels redundant in most cases
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some abjads such as arabic and hebrew have markings for vowels as well but use them only in special contexts such as for teaching
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: many scripts derived from abjads have been extended with vowel symbols to become full alphabets the most famous case being the derivation of the greek alphabet from the phoenician abjad
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this has mostly happened when the script was adapted to a non semitic language
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the term abjad takes its name from the old order of the arabic alphabet's consonants alif ba jim dal though the word may have earlier roots in phoenician or ugaritic
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: abjad is still the word for alphabet in arabic malay and indonesian
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an abugida is an alphabetic writing system whose basic signs denote consonants with an inherent vowel and where consistent modifications of the basic sign indicate other following vowels than the inherent one
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: thus in an abugida there may or may not be a sign for k with no vowel but also one for ka if a is the inherent vowel and ke is written by modifying the ka sign in a way that is consistent with how one would modify la to get le
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in many abugidas the modification is the addition of a vowel sign but other possibilities are imaginable and used such as rotation of the basic sign addition of diacritical marks and so on.the contrast with true syllabaries is that the latter have one distinct symbol per possible syllable and the signs for each syllable have no systematic graphic similarity
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the graphic similarity of most abugidas comes from the fact that they are derived from abjads and the consonants make up the symbols with the inherent vowel and the new vowel symbols are markings added on to the base symbol
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the ge'ez script for which the linguistic term abugida was named the vowel modifications do not always appear systematic although they originally were more so
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: canadian aboriginal syllabics can be considered abugidas although they are rarely thought of in those terms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the largest single group of abugidas is the brahmic family of scripts however which includes nearly all the scripts used in india and අග්නිදිග ආසියාව
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the name abugida is derived from the first four characters of an order of the ge'ez script used in some contexts
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it was borrowed from ethiopian languages as a linguistic term by peter t daniels
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a featural script represents finer detail than an alphabet
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: here symbols do not represent whole phonemes but rather the elements features that make up the phonemes such as voicing or its place of articulation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: theoretically each feature could be written with a separate letter and abjads or abugidas or indeed syllabaries could be featural but the only prominent system of this sort is korean hangul
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in hangul the featural symbols are combined into alphabetic letters and these letters are in turn joined into syllabic blocks so that the system combines three levels of phonological representation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: most writing systems are not purely one type
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the english writing system for example includes numerals and other logograms such as #, $ and & and the phonetic letters are a poor match to sound
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as mentioned above all logographic systems have phonetic components as well whether that's along the lines of a syllabary such as chinese logo-syllabic or an abjad as in egyptian logo-consonantal
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some scripts however are truly ambiguous
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the semi syllabaries of ancient spain were syllabic for plosives such as p t k but alphabetic for other consonants
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in some versions vowels were written redundantly after syllabic letters conforming to an alphabetic orthography
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: old persian cuneiform was similar
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: of 23 consonants including null seven were fully syllabic thirteen were purely alphabetic and for the other three there was one letter for cu/ and another for both ca/ and ci/
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however all vowels were written overtly regardless as in the brahmic abugidas the ca/ letter was used for a bare consonant
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the zhuyin phonetic glossing script for chinese divides syllables in two or three but into onset medial and rime rather than consonant and vowel
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pahawh hmong is similar but can be considered to divide syllables into either onset rime or consonant vowel all consonant clusters and diphthongs are written with single letters as the latter it is equivalent to an abugida but with the roles of consonant and vowel reversed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: other scripts are intermediate between the categories of alphabet abjad and abugida so there may be disagreement on how they should be classified
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: perhaps the primary graphic distinction made in classifications is that of linearity
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: linear writing systems are those in which the characters are composed of lines such as the latin alphabet and chinese characters
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: chinese characters are considered linear whether they're written with a ball point pen or a calligraphic brush or cast in bronze
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: similarly egyptian hieroglyphs and maya glyphs were often painted in linear outline form but in formal situations they were carved in bas relief
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: non linear systems on the other hand such as braille are not composed of lines no matter which instrument is used to write them
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the earliest examples of writing are linear the sumerian script of c 3300 bce was linear though its cuneiform descendants were not
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: cuneiform was probably the earliest non linear writing
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: its glyphs were formed by pressing the end of a reed stylus into moist clay not by tracing lines in the clay with the stylus as had been done previously
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the result was a radical transformation of the appearance of the script
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: braille is a non linear adaptation of the latin alphabet that completely abandoned the latin forms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the letters are composed of raised bumps on the writing substrate which can be leather louis braille's original material stiff paper plastic or metal
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are also transient non linear adaptations of the latin alphabet including morse code the manual alphabets of various sign languages and semaphore in which flags or bars are positioned at prescribed angles
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however if writing is defined as a potentially permanent means of recording information then these systems do not qualify as writing at all since the symbols disappear as soon as they are used
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if the edo script is indeed a complete writing system it may be the only natural example of a script in which the color of the graphemes is contrastive
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: scripts are also graphically characterized by the direction in which they are written
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: egyptian hieroglyphs were written in either horizontal direction with the animal and human glyphs turned to face the beginning of the line
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the early alphabet could be written in multiple directions horizontally left-to-right or right to left or vertically up or down
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it was commonly written boustrophedonically starting in one horizontal direction then turning at the end of the line and reversing direction
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the greek alphabet and its successors settled on a left to right pattern from the top to the bottom of the page
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in timed text tt authoring format this pattern is abbreviated lrtb
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: other scripts such as arabic and hebrew came to be written right to left
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: scripts that incorporate chinese characters have traditionally been written vertically top-to-bottom from the right to the left of the page but nowadays are frequently written left to right top to bottom due to western influence a growing need to accommodate terms in the roman alphabet and technical limitations in popular electronic document formats
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the uighur alphabet and its descendants are unique in being the only scripts written top to bottom left to right this direction originated from an ancestral semitic direction by rotating the page 90° counter clockwise to conform to the appearance of vertical chinese writing
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: several scripts used in the philippines and ඉන්දුනීසියාව such as hanuno'o are traditionally written with lines moving away from the writer from bottom to top but are read horizontally left to right
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: different iso/iec standards are defined to deal with each individual writing systems to implement them in computers or in electronic form
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: today most of those standards are redefined in a better collective standard the iso 10646 also known as unicode
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in unicode each character in every language's writing system is simplifying slightly given a unique identification number known as its code point
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the computer's software uses the code point to look up the appropriate character in the font file so the characters can be displayed on the page or screen
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a keyboard is the device most commonly used for writing via computer
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: each key is associated with a standard code which the keyboard sends to the computer when it is pressed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: by using a combination of alphabetic keys with modifier keys such as ctrl alt shift and altgr various character codes are generated and sent to the cpu
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the operating system intercepts and converts those signals to the appropriate characters based on the keyboard layout and input method and then delivers those converted codes and characters to the running application software which in turn looks up the appropriate glyph in the currently used font file and requests the operating system to draw these on the screen
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in computers and telecommunication systems graphemes and other grapheme like units that are required for text processing are represented by characters that typically manifest in encoded form
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for technical aspects of computer support for various writing systems see universal character set cjk chinese japanese korean and bi directional text as well as
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: t යනු නිරපේක්ෂ උෂ්ණත්වය වේ නම් ප්‍රතිවර්ත්‍ය ස්ථිරතාපී ක්‍රියාවලියක් සඳහාමෙහි du යනු පද්ධතියේ අභ්‍යන්තර ශක්ති වෙනස වන අතර δw යනු පද්ධතිය මඟින් කෙ‍රුණු කාර්යය වේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ‍බාහිරින් පද්ධතිය වෙත ශක්තිය ලැබීමත් δq සිදු නොවන බැවින් පද්ධතිය මඟින් සිදු කරන ඕනෑම කාර්යයක් δw සඳහා එහි අභ්‍යන්තර ශක්තිය u වැය කළ යුතුය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: පද්ධතිය මඟින් සිදු කළ පීඩන පරිමා කාර්යය δw පහත ලෙස අර්ථ දැක්විය හැක.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/adiabatic_process#ideal_gas_.28reversible_case_only.29

lines.value: ළමා වෛද්‍යවේදය(pediatrics යනු වෛද්‍ය විද්‍යාවේ උප විෂය කාණ්ඩයකි .මෙම විෂය මගින් ළදරුවන් හා දරුවන්ගේ සෞඛ්‍ය තත්වය පිළිබද විමසා බලයි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ඉංග්‍රීසි බසින් ළමා රෝග විශේෂඥ වෛද්‍යවරයා හදුන්වන pediatrics යන වචනයහි තේරුම දරුවන් සුවකරන්නා healer of children යන්නයි.ග්‍රීක භාෂාවේ pais = child දරුවා සහ iatros = doctor or healer සුවකරන්නා යන වචන වලින් pediatrics යන වදන නිරුක්තිය ලබා ඇත
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatrics differs from adult medicine in many respects
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the obvious body size differences are paralleled by maturational changes
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the smaller body of an infant or neonate is substantially different physiologically from that of an adult
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: congenital defects genetic variance and developmental issues are of greater concern to pediatricians than they often are to adult physicians
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: childhood is the period of greatest growth development and maturation of the various organ systems in the body
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: years of training and experience above and beyond basic medical training goes into recognizing the difference between normal variants and what is actually pathological
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: treating a child is not like treating a miniature adult
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a major difference between pediatrics and adult medicine is that children are minors and in most jurisdictions cannot make decisions for themselves
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the issues of guardianship privacy legal responsibility and informed consent must always be considered in every pediatric procedure
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in a sense pediatricians often have to treat the parents and sometimes the family rather than just the child
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: adolescents are in their own legal class having rights to their own health care decisions in certain circumstances only
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the 9th century the famous persian physician rhazes muhammad ibn zakariya razi wrote the diseases of children the first book to deal with pediatrics as an independent field of medicine
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for this reason some medical historians consider him the father of pediatrics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: his teacher ali ibn sahl rabban al tabari was also a pioneer in the field of child development which he earlier discussed in his firdous al hikmah
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the first work on pediatrics in the western world was the book of children written circa 1530 by thomas phaer who was inspired by the works of rhazes and avicenna
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatrics as a separate area of medical practice in the western world largely began in the nineteenth century
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the hospital for sick children great ormond street london was founded in 1852 and is probably the oldest such children's hospital in the english speaking world
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: great ormond street is adjacent to coram's fields the site of the much earlier foundling hospital
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the emigrant german physician abraham jacobi worked in the same period and is often considered the father of pediatrics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the training of pediatricians varies considerably across the world
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: like other medical practitioners pediatricians begin their training with an entry level medical education a tertiary level course undertaken at a medical school attached to a university
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: such a course leads to a medical degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: depending on jurisdiction and university a medical degree course may be either undergraduateentry or graduate entry
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the former commonly takes five or six years and has been usual in the commonwealth
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: entrants to graduate entry courses as in the usa usually lasting four or five years have previously completed a three or four year university degree commonly but by no means always in sciences
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: medical graduates hold a degree specific to the country and university in and from which they graduated
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this degree qualifies that medical practitioner to become licensed or registered under the laws of that particular country and sometimes of several countries subject to requirements for internship or conditional registration
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: within the united states the term physician also describes holders of the doctor of osteopathic medicine d.o degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for further information on osteopathic medicine see the entry on the comparison of md and do in the us
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatricians must undertake further training in their chosen field
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this may take from three to six or more years depending on jurisdiction and the degree of specialization
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the post graduate training for a primary care physician including primary care pediatricians is generally not as lengthy as for a hospital based medical specialist
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in most jurisdictions entry level degrees are common to all branches of the medical profession but in some jurisdictions specialization in pediatrics may begin before completion of this degree
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in some jurisdictions pediatric training is begun immediately following completion of entry level training
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in other jurisdictions junior medical doctors must undertake generalist unstreamed training for a number of years before commencing pediatric or any other specialization
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: specialist training is often largely under the control of pediatric organizations see below rather than universities with varying degrees of government input depending on jurisdiction
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatricians have different roles in different countries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the usa a pediatrician is a specialist physician who generally functions in a primary care setting for children
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: like all physicians they first receive a general medical degree from a us medical school typically md or do
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in addition pediatricians complete an internship in pediatrics and then two additional years of residency in pediatrics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a similar situation exists in germany a pediatrician () is commonly a primary care physician for children
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the uk and many other parts of the world a pediatrician is also a specialist physician for children but generally not in primary care
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: he or she sees children who are either urgently taken to a hospital or who are referred by general practitioners the latter see the bulk of child patients in primary care
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatricians generally first receive a general medical degree typically mb bs mb bchir etc and then complete at least two years general clinical training foundation training followed by six or more years additional training in pediatrics or its subspecialties
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: specialist pediatricians may undergo further training in sub specialties
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: practicing a subspecialty in pediatrics is similar in some respects to practising the relevant adult specialty but a major difference is in the pattern of disease
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: typically diseases commonly seen in children are rare in adults e.g bronchiolitis rotavirus infection and those seen in adults are rare in children e.g coronary artery disease deep vein thrombosis
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: hence pediatric cardiologists deal with the heart conditions of children particularly congenital heart defects and pediatric oncologists most often treat types of cancer that are relatively common in children e.g certain leukemias lymphomas and sarcomas but which are rarely seen in adults
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: every subspecialty of adult medicine exists in pediatrics with the obvious exception of geriatrics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: adolescent medicine is a growing sub specialty
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the pattern of diseases in adolescents in part resembles that seen in older adults and specialists or sub specialists in adolescent medicine are also drawn from practitioners of internal medicine or family medicine
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: another major sub specialty which is unique to pediatrics is neonatology the medical care of newborn babies
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: most pediatricians are members of a national body
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: examples are the american academy of pediatrics the canadian paediatric society the royal college of paediatrics and child health norsk barnelegeforening the norwegian society of pediatricians or the indian academy of pediatrics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in australia and new zealand paediatricians are fellows of the royal australasian college of physicians which covers both nations and which has adult & paediatric sections
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this was the situation in the uk until the late 1990s where specialist pediatricians were members fellows of either the royal college of physicians or of the fraternal colleges in scotland
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in 1996 british paediatricians were granted a royal charter to form their own college the royal college of paediatrics and child health
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: like other medical practitioners pediatricians are traditionally considered to be members of a learned profession because of the extensive training requirements and also because of the occupation's special ethical and legal duties
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: pediatricians commonly enjoy high social status often combined with expectations of a high and stable income and job security
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however medical practitioners in general often work long and inflexible hours with shifts at unsociable times and may earn less than other professionals whose education is of comparable length
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: neonatologists or general pediatricians in hospital practice are often on call at unsociable times for perinatal problems in particular - such as for cesarean section or other high risk births and for the care of ill newborn infants
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in august 2000 during a name and shame campaign by rupert murdoch's news of the world a paediatrician in wales had her home and car vandalised by vigilantes who believed paediatrician meant paedophile
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: අන්තර් රාජ්‍යයීය දේශ ගුණික වෙනස් වීම් පිළිබඳ සමුළුව හෙවත් ipcc නිර්ණය කරන පරිදි 20 වන ශත වර්ෂයේ මැද භාගයේදී නිරීක්ෂිත ගෝලිය මධ්‍යන්‍ය උෂ්ණත්වය‍න්ගේ වැඩිවීම්වලට හේතුව වශයෙන් නිරීක්ෂණය කොට ඇත්තේ මිනිසා විසින් නිර්මාණය කරන ලද හරිතාගාර වායු සාන්ද්‍රණයන්ගේ ඉහළ යෑම් හරහා හරිතාගාර ආචරණය ඇති වීමයි

lines.value: සමශිකෝෂින ප්‍රදේශවල ජනගහනය වැඩිකිරීමෙන් සීතල‍ට මුහුන දීමට හැකි නිසා මරණ අඩුවීම වැනි යම් වාසි පෙන්නුම් කරන බව පවසන්නේ ii වැනි ක්‍රියාකාරි කණ්ඩායම් මඟින් නිකුත් කරන ලද ipcc 3 වැනි තක්සේරු වාර්තාවෙන් විය හැක

lines.value: මෙයින් කෘෂිකර්මාන්තයට විපාක ඇතිවන අතරම තර්බෝහෙලයින් ධාවනය ප්‍රමාද කිරීමේ හැකියාව ඕසෝන් තට්ටුවේ අඩුවීම හරීකේන්ස්වල වේගය වැඩිවීම හා උග්‍ර දේශගුණික සිදුවීම් සාගර ph පහත බැසීම මැලේරියා හා ඩෙංගු උණ වැනි ලෙඩ පැතිරීමද සිදුවේ

lines.value: දේශපාලන සංස්කෘතිය යන සංකල්පය දේශපාලන විද්වතුන් අතර වඩාත් ජනප්‍රිය වන්නේ 1950 දශකය තුළදීය.දේශපාලන සංස්කෘතිය යන සංකල්පය කේන්ද්‍රකරගෙන එදා සිට මේ දක්වා දේශපාලන විද්‍යා විෂය භූමිය තුළ ලියවිලි විශාල ප්‍රමාණයක් එකතු වී ඇත.දේශපාලන සංස්කෘතිය සංකල්පයේ පුරෝගාමී දේශපාලන විද්‍යාඥයන් වන ආමන්ඩ් හා වර්මා විසින් දේශපාලන සංස්කෘතිය දේශපාලන ක්‍රමයක් තුළ ජීවත් වන සාමාජිකයන්ගේ,දේශපාලනය උදෙසා යොමු වූ පුද්ගල ආකල්ප වල රටා විලාශය pattern of individual attitude ලෙස හදූන්වාදෙන ලදි

lines.value: එහෙයින් ඔවුන් සතු pdp 7 නමැති කුඩා පරිගණකය මත ක්‍රියාත්මක විය හැකි මෙහෙයුම් පද්ධතියක් නිර්මාණය කර එය යුනික්ස් unics ලෙස හඳුන්වන ලදී

lines.value: පසුකාලීනව එහි නාමය ලෙස වෙනස් වූ අතර ඩෙනිස් රිචී පරිගණක විද්‍යාඥයා විසින් b පරිගණක ක්‍රමලේඛ භාෂාව මඟින් වැඩිදියුණු කරන ලද පරිගණක ක්‍රමලේඛ භාෂාව ආධාරයෙන් එය වසර 1973 පමණ නැවත ක්‍රමලේඛගතකරන ලදී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: එවකට ඇමෙරිකා එක්සත් ජනපදයේ මැචුසෙට් තාක්ෂණ ආයතන‍යේ mit කාර්යේ නියුතුව සිටි රිචඩ් ස්ටෝල්මන් richard stallman නමැති පරිගණක විද්‍යාඥයා මෙම ක්‍රමලේඛණ නිදහස් නොකිරීම පිළිබඳ මහත් කණස්සල්ලට පත්ව සිටියේය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: එබැවින් වසර 1983 දී මැචුසෙට් තාක්ෂණ ආයතන‍ය හැරදමා යන ඔහු නිදහස් මෘදුකාංග පදනම ආරම්භ කරමින් වැනි නිදහස් මෙහෙයුම් පද්ධතියක් නිර්මාණය කිරීමේ අරමුණින් gnu project ව්‍යාපෘතිය ආරම්භ කලේය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ඔහු විශ්වවිද්‍යාලය්දී අධ්‍යාපනික කටයුතු සඳහා භාවිත කලේ ඔහුගේ ගුරුවරයා වු ඇමෙරිකානු ජාතික මහාචාර්ය ඇන්ඩෘ ටැනන්බෝම් විසින් ක්‍රමලේඛ ගතකරන ලද වැනි minix නමැති මෙහෙයුම් පද්ධතියයි

lines.value: පසුව ඔහු විසින් අන්තර්ජාලයට මුදාහරින ලද එම ක්‍රමලේඛණය ලොවපුරා සිටින පරිගණක ක්‍රමලේඛණ ශිල්පීන්ගේද දායකත්වයෙන් වැඩිදියුණු කිරීමෙන් අනතුරුව රිචඩ් ස්ටෝල්මන්ගේ gnu project ව්‍යාපෘතිය මඟින් නිපැයුණු වැඩසටහන් සමඟ ඒකාබද්ධ කරමින් linux මෙහෙයුම් පද්ධතිය ක්‍රියාත්මක විය

lines.value: එයට හේතුව වන්නේ එම පරිගණක භාෂාවන් සංකේතමය පරිගණක භාෂා වීමයි.එනම් 1010 වැනි ද්විමය කේත අඩංගු යාන්ත්‍ර භාෂා නොවන නිසා ඒවා උපාංග වලට සෘජුවම ක්‍රියාත්මක කරවිය නොහැකි නිසා එවැනි භාෂා වෙනත් යෙදවුමක් හරහා යාන්ත්‍ර භාෂාවට හැරවීමට ඉහත කී දෙවර්ගයේ යෙදවුම් අවශ්‍ය වේ.ඒ අනුව අැසෙම්බ්ලි භාෂාව ද සංකේතමය පරිගණක භාෂාවක් වේ.නමුත් අැසෙම්බ්ලි භාෂාව යාන්ත්‍ර භාෂාවට හැරවීමට භාවිතා කරනුයේ අැසෙම්බ්ලර් ( assembler ) නම් යෙදවුමයි

lines.value: අහිගුණ්ඨිකයා කී පමණින් එකවරට ම අපගේ සිහියට නැගෙන්නේ තැනින් තැන වාඩි ගසාගෙන නයි නැටවීම සාස්තර කීම ආදී ජීවනෝපායන්ගෙන් යැපෙමින් සැහැල්ලු සංචාරක ජීවිතයක් ගත කරන ජන කොට්ඨාසයක් ලෙස ය.ලක්දිව සෑම පළාතක ම පාහේ සාමාන්‍යයෙන් ද උතුරුමැද නැගෙනහිර හා සබරගමුව යන පළාත් වල නිරන්තරව ද මොවුන් දක්නට ලැබේ.centre|200px අහිගුණ්ඨික යන්නෙහි නියම අර්ථ නිරුක්තිය අවිනිශ්චිත ය

lines.value: අහිගුණ්ඨික යන්න බිදී අවුත් ඇත්තේ ගී කීම ගීයෙන් වසී කිරීම ආදී අරුත් ඇති ගුණ්ඨ යන සංස්කෘත ධාතුවෙනැයි සිතිය හැක.right|200px සෑම අහිගුණ්ඨික කුප්පායමක් තුළම දැඩි සංවිධානයක් ඇතිවා සේ ශ්‍රී ලංකාව පුරා විසිරී සිටින අහිගුණ්ඨික කුප්පායම් අතරද සංවිධානයක් ඇත
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: මිල මුදල් හා වෙනත් ගනුදෙනු ගැන තීරණ ගැනීමට ද ඉදිරි වර්ෂයේ එක් එක් කුප්පායමේ ගමන් මාර්ගය ආදිය ගැන කතිකා කර ගැනීම ද එහිදී සිදු කෙරේ.central|175px ශ්‍රී ලංකාවේ අහිගුණ්ඨිකයන් අතර ප්‍රචලිත ආගමික ඇදහිලි විමසා බලන කල්හි ඔවුන් දැනට ලක්වාසීන් අතර සම්මතව පවත්නා පිළිගත් ආගම් අතරින් අසවල් ආගමට අයත් දැයි එක එල්ලේම නිගමනය කිරීම අපහසු ය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: centre අහිගුණ්ඨික පිරිමියා නයි නැටවීමෙන් මුදල් උපයන අතර ගැහැනියගේ ප්‍රධාන ජීවනෝපාය වන්නේ අත බලා සාස්තර කීමයි.උතුරුමැද පළාතේ වසන අහිගුණ්ඨිකයන් අතර ජීවනෝපාය වශයෙන් කෙරෙන්නක් ලෙස විශේෂයෙන් සඳහන් කළ හැකි වන්නේ එළුවන් කුකුළන් ආදී සතුන් මස් පිණිස ඇතිකර මුස්ලිම් වරුන්ට විකිණීමයි.අහිගුණ්ඨිකයෝ ස්වකීය ජීවනෝපායට අවශ්‍ය දේ මිස සම්පත් එක් රැස්කර තබා රැක ගැනීමට උත්සාහයක් නොදරති

lines.value: ඔවුහු විශේෂයෙන් ම බල්ලන් හා බූරුවන් ද ඉතා අගය කරති.centre|150px නොනැසී ජීවත්වන්නේ කෙසේ ද යන්න සෑම මනුෂ්‍යයෙකුට ම පොදුවේ මුහුණ පෑමට ඇති ප්‍රධාන ප්‍රශ්නය යි

lines.value: අහිගුණ්ඨිකයන් සම්බන්ධයෙන් ද එය එසේම ය.200px|centre අහිගුණ්ඨික සමාජය කුලභේදයෙන් තොර වුවක් වුව ද පෙළපත් භේදය බලපැවැත් වේ.විවාහ ගනුදෙනු පිළිබද කතිකා කිරීමේදී මනාලයාගේ පියා ආරච්චි ඇතුළු පිරිසට රා සංග්‍රහයක් පැවැත්වීම සිරිත ය

lines.value: සාගරයේ වෙසෙන ජීවීන් අතරින් කැස්බෑවා chelonioidea සුවිශේෂී සත්වයෙකි.මෙම සත්ත්වයා සාගරයේ ජීවත්වන උරගයකු ලෙසද හඳුන්වයි.වායුගොලයේ ඔක්සිජන් ස්වසනය කරන සාගරයේ ජීවත් වන මොවුන් වසර දශ ලක්ෂ සියයකටත් ඈත අතීතයේ සිට පරිණාමය වෙමින් වර්තමානය දක්වා ගමන් කර ඇති බව විද්‍යාත්මක සාධක මගින් සනාථ වෙයි.පෘථිවිය මත ජීවත් වන සාර්ථක ජීවී කණ්ඩායමක් ලෙස කැස්බෑවුන් පිළි ගැනේ.මොවුන්ගේ ශරීර උෂ්ණත්වය පරිසර උෂ්ණත්වය අනුව වෙනස් වන බැවින් උදය කාලයේදී සාගරය මතුපිටට පැම්ණ සූර්ය කිරණ මගින් උෂ්ණත්වය වැඩි කර ගනී.මොවුන් පෙනහලු මගින් වාතය ආශ්වාස ප්‍රශ්වාස කරයි.කැස්බෑවන් රාත්‍රිය ගෙවා දමන්නේ අක්‍රියවය.සාගර පත්ලේ ඇති ගුහා හෝ පැලුම් තුළට වී නිදා ගැනීම සිදු කරයි
