lines.value: දැළ් කාවා(webbing clothing moth tineola bisselliella බහුලව දක්නට ලැබෙන විශේෂයයි කොෂ සාදන කාවා casemaking clothes moth tinea pellionella දැළ් සාදන කාවාට වඩා අඩු වශයෙන් දක්නට ලැබේ.මෙම කාවා අඟල් 1/8 ත් 1/4 අතර ප්‍රමාණයකට විශාලව වැඩේ.කාවා තම කෝෂය සේද වැනි කෙඳි විශේෂයක් යොදාගනිමින් සකසයි.එමගින් මෙම සත්වයා බාහිර උපදුව වලින් මිදී වාසය කරයි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ටැපැස්ට්‍රි කාවා(tapestry or carpet moth කලින් සදහන් කළ දැළ් කාවා හා කොෂ සාදන කාවා සිටින පරිසරයන්හිම වාසය කාරයි.මෙම කාවා අවුරුද්දක පමණ ජීවන චක්‍රයක් පසුකරයි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the clothing moth tineola bisselliella and the case bearing clothes moth tinea pellionella are notorious for feeding on clothing and natural fibres they have the ability to turn keratin a protein present in hair and wool into food
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: clothing moths prefer dirty fabric and are particularly attracted to carpeting and clothing that contain human sweat or other liquids which have been spilled onto them
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are attracted to these areas not for the food but for the moisture
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: moth larvae do not drink water consequently their food must contain moisture
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the development cycle of the clothing moth
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: eggs hatch into larvae which then begin to feed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: once they get their fill they pupate and undergo metamorphosis to emerge as adults
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: adults do not eat male adults look for females and adult females look for places to lay eggs
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: once their job is done they die
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: contrary to what most people believe adult clothing moths do not eat or cause any damage to clothing or fabric
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is the larvae which are solely responsible for this spending their entire time eating and foraging for food
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: both adults and larvae prefer low light conditions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: whereas most other moths are drawn to light clothing moths seem to prefer dim or dark areas
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if larvae find themselves in a well lit room they will try to relocate under furniture or carpet edges
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: hand made rugs are a favorite because it is easy for them to crawl underneath and do their damage from below
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they will also crawl under moldings at the edges of rooms in search of darkened areas which hold good food
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the most common clothing moth is the webbing clothes moth
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it prefers moist conditions although low humidity will merely slow development
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: webbing clothes moths are small moths whose adults grow to between 1 and 2 cm
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: their eggs are tiny most being under 1 mm long and barely visible
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a female will lay several hundred during her lifetime egg placement is carefully chosen in locations where they will have the best chance for survival
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the eggs are attached with a glue like substance and can be quite difficult to remove
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: after the egg hatches the larva will immediately look for food
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: larvae can obtain their required food in less than two months but if conditions are not favorable they will feed on and off for a long time
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: whether it takes two months or two years each larva will eventually spin a cocoon in which it will change into an adult
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: larvae stay in these cocoons for between one and two months and then emerge as adults ready to mate and to lay eggs
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: fabric pests such as clothes moths although not particularly dangerous can sometimes cause irreparable damage to personal belongings
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these moths are able to digest animal hairs and therefore feed on almost any item made of natural fibers particularly wool and cashmere
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: control measures can include the following clothing moth traps this step can help monitor the current infestation and prevent males from mating with females
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: vacuuming since moths like to hide in carpeting and baseboards this is an important step towards full eradication
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: dry cleaning this step kills moths on existing clothing and helps remove moisture from clothes
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: sunlight has a limited effect heat extreme high temperatures 120 degrees fahrenheit or 50 degrees celsius for 30 minutes plus
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these conditions may possibly be achieved by placing infested materials in an attic or by washing clothes at or above this temperature
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: freezing freezing the object for several days at temperatures below 32 °f or 0 °c dry ice fumigation fumigating an object with dry ice that is enclosing an object with dry ice so it is effectively bathed in a high concentration of carbon dioxide will kill all stages of clothing moths
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for details,see clothes moths management guidelines under household furnishings
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: permethrin typically an aerosol or spray works best here
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: nylar stops the life cycle
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: mothballs there are two types of mothball
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: older types are based on napthalene while more recent ones use paradichlorobenzene
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: both decay into a gaseous state
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they fall to the lowest point as a gas and need to reach a high concentration to be effective
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: cedar is of questionable value as a deterrent
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: while the volatile oil of eastern red cedar is able to kill small larvae it is difficult to maintain sufficient concentrations of it around stored articles to be effective
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: also cedar loses this quality after a few years
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: apply the chemical using a sprayer
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: be sure to get proper coverage and don't spread it too thinly
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: treat once a month for the first three months and then once a quarter for the next year to ensure the infestation is under control
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the indo iranian language group constitutes the easternmost extant branch of the indo european family of languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it consists of three language groups the indo aryan including dardic iranian and nuristani
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the term aryan languages is occasionally still used to refer to the indo iranian languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the speakers of the proto indo iranian language the hypothetical proto indo iranians are usually associated with the late 3rd millennium bc sintashta petrovka culture of central asia
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: their expansion is believed to have been connected with the invention of the chariot
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the contemporary indo iranian languages form the largest sub branch of indo european with more than one billion speakers in total stretching from යුරෝපය romani and the caucasus ossetian to xinjiang sariqoli and east india or bangladesh
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: sil in a 2005 estimate counts a total of 308 varieties the largest in terms of native speakers being hindustani hindi and urdu ca 540 million bengali ca 200 million punjabi ca 80 million marathi and persian ca 70 million each gujarati ca 45 million pashto 40 million oriya ca 30 million kurdish ca 40 million and sindhi ca 20 million ).
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: indo iranian languages were once spoken across a wider area still
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the scythians were described by roman writer strabo as inhabiting the lands to the north of the black sea in present day ukraine moldova and romania
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the river names don dnieper danube etc are of indo iranian origin
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the so called migration period saw indo iranian languages disappear from eastern europe with the arrival of the turkic speaking pechenegs and others by the eighth century ad.the oldest attested indo iranian languages are vedic sanskrit ancient indian avestan and old persian two ancient iranian languages
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: but there are written instances of a fourth language in northern mesopotamia which is considered to be indo aryan
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are attested in documents from the ancient empire of mitanni and the hittites of anatolia
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: එනම් කුඩා දරුවාම තම මව කෙරෙහි ඇති ආදරය බිය නැති කරීමට සාර්ථක ලෙස යොදා ගැනීමට නොහැකි වූ කළ පීතෘ චරිතය සමාග්‍රහණය කර ගැනීමත් සමග අධි අහංභාවය සිත තුළ බිහි වෙයි.අධි අහංභාවය පීතෘ චරිතය වැන්නක් ආදේශ කර ගත්ත ද ළදරුවා මවට දක්වන බැඳීම ප්‍රබල නම් හෝ එය ඉතා වේගයෙන් යටපත් කර දැමීමට නතු වේ නම් ආගමික පාලන ඉගැන්වීම් සහ කියවීම්වල බලපෑ‍ම නිසා ego අහංභාවයට වඩා අධි අහංභාවය පාලන බලය රඳා ගනී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: 450 දී පමණ ඩිමොක්‍රීටස් විසින් කැපිය නොහැකි"නැතහොත් පදාර්ථය තවදුරටත් බෙදිය නොහැකි කුඩාම අංශුව එනම් බෙදිය නොහැකි යන අරුත ඇති ඇ‍ටමෝස් atomos නම් පදය ග්‍රීක බසින් ἄtouos හඳුන්වා දෙන ලදී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: 1661 වසරේදී ස්වභාව දාර්ශනික රොබට් බොයිල් සිය the sceptical chymist නම් ග්‍රන්ථය ඔස්සේ පදාර්ථය විවිධ සහ එකිනෙකට වෙනස් දේහාණු නැතහොත් පරමාණු මිශ්‍රණවලින් සමන්විත වේ යැයි මතයක් පළ කළේය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: පසුව මෙම එකම මූලද්‍රව්‍යයේ වෙනස් පරමාණු සඳහා සමස්ථානික යන අරුත ඇති isotope යන ඉංග්‍රීසි වදන මාග්‍රට් ටොඩ් විසින් හඳුන්වාදෙන ලදී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: තොම්සන් අයනීකෘත වායු පිළිබඳ සිය පර්යේෂණ ඔස්සේ විවිධ වර්ගවල පරමාණු වෙන්කර ගැනීම සඳහා ක්‍රමවේදයක් නිර්මාණය කළ අතර මේ ක්‍රමය ඇසුරින් පසු කාලීන ස්ථායී සමස්ථානික සොයා ගන්නා ලදී.1985 දී පමණ bell labs පර්යේෂණාගාරයේ දී ස්ටීවන් චූ සහ ඔහුගේ සහායකයින් විසින් ලේසර් ‍භාවිතායෙන් පරමාණු සිසිල් කළ හැකි තාක්ෂණික ක්‍රමයක් ගොඩනඟන ලදී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: scanning tunneling අණ්වීක්ෂයක පරමාණු මට්ටමේ ඇති නොයෙකුත් තල පැහැදිලිව දැක ගැනීමට යොදා ගනී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: එය ක්වොන්ටම් tunneling සිද්ධිය යොදා ගන්නා අතර එමගින් අංශුවලට පාරගම්‍ය වූ බාධකයක් හරහා වුව ද ගමන් කිරීමට ඉඩ සලසා දෙයි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: පරමාණු අව‍ශෝෂණය කළ ලෝහ ඉලෙක්ට්‍රෝඩ දෙකක් අතර ඇති රික්තය තුළින් ඉලෙක්ට්‍රෝන ගමන් කරනුයේ scanning tunneling නලයේ ඝනත්වය වැඩි කරමිනි

lines.value: මෙමගින් අන්වීක්ෂය පරමාණුවේ අවකාශ‍මානයේ කාක්ෂිකවල ශක්ති මට්ටම් අනුව ඡායාරූපගත කිරීම අඩු නැඹුරුතාවක් දක්වන බව පෙනී යයි මෙය fermi level local density of states නමින් හැඳින්වේ

lines.value: තව දුරටත් සුදුසු ක්‍රමවේදයක් වනුයේ ඉලෙක්ට්‍රෝන ශක්ති හානි වර්ණාවලීක්ෂණයයි මෙමගින් transmission ඉලෙක්ට්‍රෝන අන්වීක්ෂයක ඇති ඉලෙක්ට්‍රෝන කදම්බයක ශක්ති හානිය ගණනය කරයි

lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a නම් න්‍යාසයක i j ඇතුළත් කිරීම බහුල වශයෙන් භාවිත කරනුයේ a i,j ලෙසිනි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a[i,j] හෝ a i,j යනු මේ සඳහා භාවිතා කරනු ලබන වෙනත් සංකේත වේ.sometimes a matrix is referred to by giving a formula for its i,j th entry often with double parenthesis around the formula for the entry for example if the i,j th entry of a were given by a ij a would be denoted a ij )).an asterisk is commonly used to refer to whole rows or columns in a matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example a i,∗ refers to the i th row of a and a ∗,j refers to the j th column of a the set of all m by n matrices is denoted can alternatively be specified by a = [i − j] i = 12,3 j = 1,...,4 or simply a = i-j where the size of the matrix is understood
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some programming languages start the numbering of rows and columns at zero in which case the entries of an m by n matrix are indexed by 0 ≤ i ≤ m − 1 and 0 ≤ j ≤ n − 1
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this article follows the more common convention in mathematical writing where enumeration starts from 1
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are a number of operations that can be applied to modify matrices called matrix addition scalar multiplication and transposition
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these form the basic techniques to deal with matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: familiar properties of numbers extend to these operations of matrices for example addition is commutative i.e the matrix sum does not depend on the order of the summands a + b = b + a the transpose is compatible with addition and scalar multiplication as expressed by ca t = c(a t ) and a + b t = a t + b t
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: finally a t ) t = a row operations are ways to change matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are three types of row operations row switching that is interchanging two rows of a matrix row multiplication multiplying all entries of a row by a non zero constant and finally row addition which means adding a multiple of a row to another row
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these row operations are used in a number of ways including solving linear equations and finding inverses
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: multiplication of two matrices is defined only if the number of columns of the left matrix is the same as the number of rows of the right matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if a is an m by n matrix and b is an n by p matrix then their matrix product ab is the m by p matrix whose entries are given by dot product of the corresponding row of a and the corresponding column of b :<cite id=matrix_product> matrix multiplication satisfies the rules ab)c = a(bc associativity and a+b)c = ac+bc as well as c(a+b = ca+cb left and right distributivity whenever the size of the matrices is such that the various products are defined
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the product ab may be defined without ba being defined namely if a and b are m by n and n by k matrices respectively and m ≠ k even if both products are defined they need not be equal i.e generally one has :ab ≠ ba i.e <cite id=non_commutative>matrix multiplication is not commutative in marked contrast to rational real or complex numbers whose product is independent of the order of the factors
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an example of two matrices not commuting with each other is it is called identity matrix because multiplication with it leaves a matrix unchanged mi n = i m m = m for any m by n matrix m besides the ordinary matrix multiplication just described there exist other less frequently used operations on matrices that can be considered forms of multiplication such as the hadamard product and the kronecker product
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they arise in solving matrix equations such as the sylvester equation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a particular case of matrix multiplication is tightly linked to linear equations if x designates a column vector i.e nx1-matrix of n variables x 1 x 2 , , x n , and a is an m by n matrix then the matrix equation :ax = b where b is some mx1-column vector is equivalent to the system of linear equations
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices and matrix multiplication reveal their essential features when related to linear transformations also known as linear maps
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: <cite id=linear_maps>a real m by n matrix a gives rise to a linear transformation r n → r m mapping each vector x in r n to the matrix product ax which is a vector in r m
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: conversely each linear transformation f r n → r m arises from a unique m by n matrix a explicitly the i j)-entry of a is the i th coordinate of f(e j ), where e j = 0,...,01,0,...,0 is the unit vector with 1 in the j th position and 0 elsewhere
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the matrix a is said to represent the linear map f and a is called the transformation matrix of f for example the 2×2 matrix : in turn
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these vectors define the vertices of the unit square
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the following table shows a number of 2-by-2 matrices with the associated linear maps of r 2
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the blue original is mapped to the green grid and shapes the origin 00 is marked with a black point
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: under the 1-to-1 correspondence between matrices and linear maps matrix multiplication corresponds to composition of maps if a k by m matrix b represents another linear map g : r m → r k then the composition g ∘ f is represented by ba since :(g ∘ f)(x = g(f(x = g(ax = b(ax = ba)x
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the last equality follows from the above mentioned associativity of matrix multiplication
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the rank of a matrix a is the maximum number of linearly independent row vectors of the matrix which is the same as the maximum number of linearly independent column vectors
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: equivalently it is the dimension of the image of the linear map represented by a the rank nullity theorem states that the dimension of the kernel of a matrix plus the rank equals the number of columns of the matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a square matrix is a matrix with the same number of rows and columns
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an n by n matrix is known as a square matrix of order n any two square matrices of the same order can be added and multiplied
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a square matrix a is called invertible or non singular if there exists a matrix b such that : ab = i n
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this is equivalent to ba = i n
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: moreover if b exists it is unique and is called the inverse matrix of a denoted a −1
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the entries a i,i form the main diagonal of a matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the trace tr(a of a square matrix a is the sum of its diagonal entries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: while as mentioned above matrix multiplication is not commutative the trace of the product of two matrices is independent of the order of the factors tr(ab = tr(ba
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: also the trace of a matrix is equal to that of its transpose i.e tr(a = tr(a t ).
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if all entries outside the main diagonal are zero a is called a diagonal matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if only all entries above below the main diagonal are zero a is called a lower triangular matrix upper triangular matrix respectively
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example if n = 3 they look like : upper triangular matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the determinant det(a or |a| of a square matrix a is a number encoding certain properties of the matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a matrix is invertible if and only if its determinant is nonzero
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: its absolute value equals the area in r 2 ) or volume in r 3 ) of the image of the unit square or cube while its sign corresponds to the orientation of the corresponding linear map the determinant is positive if and only if the orientation is preserved
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the determinant of 2-by-2 matrices is given by when the determinant is equal to one then the matrix represents an equi areal mapping
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the determinant of 3-by-3 matrices involves 6 terms rule of sarrus
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the more lengthy leibniz formula generalises these two formulae to all dimensions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the determinant of a product of square matrices equals the product of their determinants det(ab = det(a · det(b
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: adding a multiple of any row to another row or a multiple of any column to another column does not change the determinant
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: interchanging two rows or two columns affects the determinant by multiplying it by −1
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: using these operations any matrix can be transformed to a lower or upper triangular matrix and for such matrices the determinant equals the product of the entries on the main diagonal this provides a method to calculate the determinant of any matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: finally the laplace expansion expresses the determinant in terms of minors i.e determinants of smaller matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this expansion can be used for a recursive definition of determinants taking as starting case the determinant of a 1-by-1 matrix which is its unique entry or even the determinant of a 0-by-0 matrix which is 1 that can be seen to be equivalent to the leibniz formula
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: determinants can be used to solve linear systems using cramer's rule where the division of the determinants of two related square matrices equates to the value of each of the system's variables
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a number a and a non zero vector v satisfying :av = av are called an eigenvalue and an eigenvector of a respectively
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the number a is an eigenvalue of an nxn-matrix a if and only if a−ai n is not invertible which is equivalent to the function p a t = det(a−ti is called the characteristic polynomial of a its degree is n therefore p a t has at most n different roots i.e eigenvalues of the matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they may be complex even if the entries of a are real
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: according to the cayley hamilton theorem p a a = 0 that is to say the characteristic polynomial applied to the matrix itself yields the zero matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a square matrix a that is equal to its transpose i.e a = a t , is a symmetric matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if instead a was equal to the negative of its transpose i.e a = −a t , then a is a skew symmetric matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in complex matrices symmetry is often replaced by the concept of hermitian matrices which satisfy a ∗ = a where the star or asterisk denotes the conjugate transpose of the matrix i.e the transpose of the complex conjugate of a by the spectral theorem real symmetric matrices and complex hermitian matrices have an eigenbasis i.e every vector is expressible as a linear combination of eigenvectors
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in both cases all eigenvalues are real
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this theorem can be generalized to infinite dimensional situations related to matrices with infinitely many rows and columns see below
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a symmetric nxn-matrix is called positive definite respectively negative definite indefinite if for all nonzero vectors x ∈ r n the associated quadratic form given by :<cite id=quadratic_forms>q(x = x t ax takes only positive values respectively only negative values both some negative and some positive values
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if the quadratic form takes only non negative respectively only non positive values the symmetric matrix is called positive semidefinite respectively negative semidefinite hence the matrix is indefinite precisely when it is neither positive semidefinite nor negative semidefinite
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a symmetric matrix is positive definite if and only if all its eigenvalues are positive
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the table at the right shows two possibilities for 2-by-2 matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: allowing as input two different vectors instead yields the bilinear form associated to a :b a x y = x t ay
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in addition to theoretical knowledge of properties of matrices and their relation to other fields it is important for practical purposes to perform matrix calculations effectively and precisely
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the domain studying these matters is called numerical linear algebra
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as with other numerical situations two main aspects are the complexity of algorithms and their numerical stability
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: many problems can be solved by both direct algorithms or iterative approaches
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example finding eigenvectors can be done by finding a sequence of vectors x n converging to an eigenvector when n tends to infinity
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: determining the complexity of an algorithm means finding upper bounds or estimates of how many elementary operations such as additions and multiplications of scalars are necessary to perform some algorithm e.g multiplication of matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example calculating the matrix product of two n by n matrix using the definition given above needs n 3 multiplications since for any of the n 2 entries of the product n multiplications are necessary
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the strassen algorithm outperforms this naive algorithm it needs only n 2.807 multiplications
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a refined approach also incorporates specific features of the computing devices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in many practical situations additional information about the matrices involved is known
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an important case are sparse matrices i.e matrices most of whose entries are zero
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are specifically adapted algorithms for say solving linear systems ax = b for sparse matrices a such as the conjugate gradient method
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an algorithm is roughly speaking numerically stable if little deviations such as rounding errors do not lead to big deviations in the result
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example calculating the inverse of a matrix via laplace's formula adj a denotes the adjugate matrix of a :a −1 = adj(a det(a may lead to significant rounding errors if the determinant of the matrix is very small
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the norm of a matrix can be used to capture the conditioning of linear algebraic problems such as computing a matrix inverse
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: although most computer languages are not designed with commands or libraries for matrices as early as the 1970s some engineering desktop computers such as the hp 9830 had rom cartridges to add basic commands for matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some computer languages such as apl were designed to manipulate matrices and various mathematical programs can be used to aid computing with matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are several methods to render matrices into a more easily accessible form
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are generally referred to as matrix transformation or matrix decomposition techniques
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the interest of all these decomposition techniques is that they preserve certain properties of the matrices in question such as determinant rank or inverse so that these quantities can be calculated after applying the transformation or that certain matrix operations are algorithmically easier to carry out for some types of matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the lu decomposition factors matrices as a product of lower l and an upper triangular matrices u
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: once this decomposition is calculated linear systems can be solved more efficiently by a simple technique called forward and back substitution
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: likewise inverses of triangular matrices are algorithmically easier to calculate
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the gaussian elimination is a similar algorithm it transforms any matrix to row echelon form
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: both methods proceed by multiplying the matrix by suitable elementary matrices which correspond to permuting rows or columns and adding multiples of one row to another row
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: singular value decomposition expresses any matrix a as a product udv ∗ where u and v are unitary matrices and d is a diagonal matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the eigendecomposition or diagonalization expresses a as a product vdv −1 where d is a diagonal matrix and v is a suitable invertible matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if a can be written in this form it is called diagonalizable
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more generally and applicable to all matrices the jordan decomposition transforms a matrix into jordan normal form that is to say matrices whose only nonzero entries are the eigenvalues a 1 to a n of a placed on the main diagonal and possibly entries equal to one directly above the main diagonal as shown at the right
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: given the eigendecomposition the n th power of a i.e n fold iterated matrix multiplication can be calculated via :a n = vdv −1 ) n = vdv −1 vdv −1 vdv −1 = vd n v −1 and the power of a diagonal matrix can be calculated by taking the corresponding powers of the diagonal entries which is much easier than doing the exponentiation for a instead
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this can be used to compute the matrix exponential e a a need frequently arising in solving linear differential equations matrix logarithms and square roots of matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: to avoid numerically ill conditioned situations further algorithms such as the schur decomposition can be employed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices can be generalized in different ways
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: abstract algebra uses matrices with entries in more general fields or even rings while linear algebra codifies properties of matrices in the notion of linear maps
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is possible to consider matrices with infinitely many columns and rows
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: another extension are tensors which can be seen as higher dimensional arrays of numbers as opposed to vectors which can often be realised as sequences of numbers while matrices are rectangular or two dimensional array of numbers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices subject to certain requirements tend to form groups known as matrix groups
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this article focuses on matrices whose entries are real or complex numbers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: <cite id=more_general_entries>however matrices can be considered with much more general types of entries than real or complex numbers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: as a first step of generalization any field i.e a set where addition subtraction multiplication and division operations are defined and well behaved may be used instead of r or c for example rational numbers or finite fields
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example coding theory makes use of matrices over finite fields
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: wherever eigenvalues are considered as these are roots of a polynomial they may exist only in a larger field than that of the coefficients of the matrix for instance they may be complex in case of a matrix with real entries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the possibility to reinterpret the entries of a matrix as elements of a larger field e.g to view a real matrix as a complex matrix whose entries happen to be all real then allows considering each square matrix to possess a full set of eigenvalues
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: alternatively one can consider only matrices with entries in an algebraically closed field such as c from the outset
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more generally abstract algebra makes great use of matrices with entries in a ring r rings are a more general notion than fields in that no division operation exists
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the very same addition and multiplication operations of matrices extend to this setting too
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the set m(n r of all square n by n matrices over r is a ring called matrix ring isomorphic to the endomorphism ring of the left r module r n
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if the ring r is commutative i.e its multiplication is commutative then m(n r is a unitary noncommutative unless n = 1 associative algebra over r the determinant of square matrices over a commutative ring r can still be defined using the leibniz formula such a matrix is invertible if and only if its determinant is invertible in r generalising the situation over a field f where every nonzero element is invertible
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices over superrings are called supermatrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices do not always have all their entries in the same ring - or even in any ring at all
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: one special but common case is block matrices which may be considered as matrices whose entries themselves are matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the entries need not be quadratic matrices and thus need not be members of any ordinary ring but their sizes must fulfil certain compatibility conditions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: linear maps r n → r m are equivalent to m by n matrices as described above
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more generally any linear map f v → w between finite dimensional vector spaces can be described by a matrix a = a ij ), after choosing bases v 1 , v n of v and w 1 , , w m of w so n is the dimension of v and m is the dimension of w which is such that in other words column j of a expresses the image of v j in terms of the basis vectors w i of w thus this relation uniquely determines the entries of the matrix a note that the matrix depends on the choice of the bases different choices of bases give rise to different but equivalent matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: many of the above concrete notions can be reinterpreted in this light for example the transpose matrix a t describes the transpose of the linear map given by a with respect to the dual bases
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: more generally the set of mxn matrices can be used to represent the r linear maps between the free modules r m and r n for an arbitrary ring r with unity
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: when n = m composition of these maps is possible and this gives rise to the matrix ring of nxn matrices representing the endomorphism ring of r n
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a group is a mathematical structure consisting of a set of objects together with a binary operation i.e an operation combining any two objects to a third subject to certain requirements
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a group in which the objects are matrices and the group operation is matrix multiplication is called a matrix group
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: since in a group every element has to be invertible the most general matrix groups are the groups of all invertible matrices of a given size called the general linear groups
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: any property of matrices that is preserved under matrix products and inverses can be used to define further matrix groups
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example matrices with a given size and with a determinant of 1 form a subgroup of i.e a smaller group contained in their general linear group called a special linear group
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: orthogonal matrices determined by the condition :m t m = i,form the orthogonal group
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are called orthogonal since the associated linear transformations of r n preserve angles in the sense that the scalar product of two vectors is unchanged after applying m to them :(mv) &middot mw = v &middot w every finite group is isomorphic to a matrix group as one can see by considering the regular representation of the symmetric group
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: general groups can be studied using matrix groups which are comparatively well understood by means of representation theory
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it is also possible to consider matrices with infinitely many rows and or columns even if being infinite objects one cannot write down such matrices explicitly
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: all that matters is that for every element in the set indexing rows and every element in the set indexing columns there is a well defined entry these index sets need not even be subsets of the natural numbers
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the basic operations of addition subtraction scalar multiplication and transposition can still be defined without problem however matrix multiplication may involve infinite summations to define the resulting entries and these are not defined in general
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if r is any ring with unity then the ring of endomorphisms of whose rows each only have finitely many nonzero entries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if infinite matrices are used to describe linear maps then only those matrices can be used all of whose columns have but a finite number of nonzero entries for the following reason
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for a matrix a to describe a linear map f v→w bases for both spaces must have been chosen recall that by definition this means that every vector in the space can be written uniquely as a finite linear combination of basis vectors so that written as a column vector v of coefficients only finitely many entries v i are nonzero
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: now the columns of a describe the images by f of individual basis vectors of v in the basis of w which is only meaningful if these columns have only finitely many nonzero entries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there is no restriction on the rows of a however in the product a·v there are only finitely many nonzero coefficients of v involved so every one of its entries even if it is given as an infinite sum of products involves only finitely many nonzero terms and is therefore well defined
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: moreover this amounts to forming a linear combination of the columns of a that effectively involves only finitely many of them whence the result has only finitely many nonzero entries because each of those columns do
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: one also sees that products of two matrices of the given type is well defined provided as usual that the column index and row index sets match is again of the same type and corresponds to the composition of linear maps
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if r is a normed ring then the condition of row or column finiteness can be relaxed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: with the norm in place absolutely convergent series can be used instead of finite sums
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example the matrices whose column sums are absolutely convergent sequences form a ring
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: analogously of course the matrices whose row sums are absolutely convergent series also form a ring
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in that vein infinite matrices can also be used to describe operators on hilbert spaces where convergence and continuity questions arise which again results in certain constraints that have to be imposed
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however the explicit point of view of matrices tends to obfuscate the matter and the abstract and more powerful tools of functional analysis can be used instead
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: an empty matrix is a matrix in which the number of rows or columns or both is zero
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: empty matrices help dealing with maps involving the zero vector space
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example if a is a 3-by-0 matrix a and b is a 0-by-3 matrix then ab is the 3-by-3 zero matrix corresponding to the null map from a 3-dimensional space v to itself while ba is a 0-by-0 matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there is no common notation for empty matrices but most computer algebra systems allow creating and computing with them
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the determinant of the 0-by-0 matrix is 1 as follows from regarding the empty product occurring in the leibniz formula for the determinant as 1
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this value is also consistent with the fact that the identity map from any finite dimensional space to itself has determinant 1 a fact that is often used as a part of the characterization of determinants
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: there are numerous applications of matrices both in mathematics and other sciences
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: some of them merely take advantage of the compact representation of a set of numbers in a matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example in game theory and economics the payoff matrix encodes the payoff for two players depending on which out of a given finite set of alternatives the players choose
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: text mining and automated thesaurus compilation makes use of document term matrices such as tf idf to track frequencies of certain words in several documents
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: complex numbers can be represented by particular real 2-by-2 matrices via under which addition and multiplication of complex numbers and matrices correspond to each other
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example 2-by-2 rotation matrices represent the multiplication with some complex number of absolute value 1 as above
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a similar interpretation is possible for quaternions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: early encryption techniques such as the hill cipher also used matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: however due to the linear nature of matrices these codes are comparatively easy to break
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: computer graphics uses matrices both to represent objects and to calculate transformations of objects using affine rotation matrices to accomplish tasks such as projecting a three dimensional object onto a two dimensional screen corresponding to a theoretical camera observation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices over a polynomial ring are important in the study of control theory
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: chemistry makes use of matrices in various ways particularly since the use of quantum theory to discuss molecular bonding and spectroscopy
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: examples are the overlap matrix and the fock matrix used in solving the roothaan equations to obtain the molecular orbitals of the hartree fock method
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the adjacency matrix of a finite graph is a basic notion of graph theory
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it saves which vertices of the graph are connected by an edge
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices containing just two different values 0 and 1 meaning for example yes and no are called logical matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the distance or cost matrix contains information about distances of the edges
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: these concepts can be applied to websites connected hyperlinks or cities connected by roads etc in which case unless the road network is extremely dense the matrices tend to be sparse i.e contain few nonzero entries
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: therefore specifically tailored matrix algorithms can be used in network theory
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the hessian matrix of a differentiable function f r n → r consists of the second derivatives of f with respect to the several coordinate directions i.e : of f vanish the function has a local minimum if the hessian matrix is positive definite
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: quadratic programming can be used to find global minima or maxima of quadratic functions closely related to the ones attached to matrices see above
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: another matrix frequently used in geometrical situations is the <cite id=jacobi_matrix>jacobi matrix of a differentiable map f r n → r m
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if f 1 , f m denote the components of f then the jacobi matrix is defined as if n > m and if the rank of the jacobi matrix attains its maximal value m f is locally invertible at that point by the implicit function theorem
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: partial differential equations can be classified by considering the matrix of coefficients of the highest order differential operators of the equation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for elliptic partial differential equations this matrix is positive definite which has decisive influence on the set of possible solutions of the equation in question
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the finite element method is an important numerical method to solve partial differential equations widely applied in simulating complex physical systems
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: it attempts to approximate the solution to some equation by piecewise linear functions where the pieces are chosen with respect to a sufficiently fine grid which in turn can be recast as a matrix equation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: stochastic matrices are square matrices whose rows are probability vectors i.e whose entries sum up to one
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: stochastic matrices are used to define markov chains with finitely many states
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a row of the stochastic matrix gives the probability distribution for the next position of some particle currently in the state that corresponds to the row
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: properties of the markov chain like absorbing states i.e states that any particle attains eventually can be read off the eigenvectors of the transition matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: statistics also makes use of matrices in many different forms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: descriptive statistics is concerned with describing data sets which can often be represented in matrix form by reducing the amount of data
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the covariance matrix encodes the mutual variance of several random variables
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: another technique using matrices are linear least squares a method that approximates a finite set of pairs x 1 y 1 ), x 2 , y 2 ), , x n , y n ), by a linear function :y i ≈ ax i + b i = 1 , n which can be formulated in terms of matrices related to the singular value decomposition of matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: random matrices are matrices whose entries are random numbers subject to suitable probability distributions such as matrix normal distribution
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: beyond probability theory they are applied in domains ranging from number theory to physics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: linear transformations and the associated symmetries play a key role in modern physics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example elementary particles in quantum field theory are classified as representations of the lorentz group of special relativity and more specifically by their behavior under the spin group
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: concrete representations involving the pauli matrices and more general gamma matrices are an integral part of the physical description of fermions which behave as spinors
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for the three lightest quarks there is a group theoretical representation involving the special unitary group su(3 for their calculations physicists use a convenient matrix representation known as the gell mann matrices which are also used for the su(3 gauge group that forms the basis of the modern description of strong nuclear interactions quantum chromodynamics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the cabibbo–kobayashi–maskawa matrix in turn expresses the fact that the basic quark states that are important for weak interactions are not the same as but linearly related to the basic quark states that define particles with specific and distinct masses
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the first model of quantum mechanics heisenberg 1925 represented the theory's operators by infinite dimensional matrices acting on quantum states
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: this is also referred to as matrix mechanics
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: one particular example is the density matrix that characterizes the mixed state of a quantum system as a linear combination of elementary pure eigenstates
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: another matrix serves as a key tool for describing the scattering experiments that form the cornerstone of experimental particle physics collision reactions such as occur in particle accelerators where non interacting particles head towards each other and collide in a small interaction zone with a new set of non interacting particles as the result can be described as the scalar product of outgoing particle states and a linear combination of ingoing particle states
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the linear combination is given by a matrix known as the s matrix which encodes all information about the possible interactions between particles
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a general application of matrices in physics is to the description of linearly coupled harmonic systems
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the equations of motion of such systems can be described in matrix form with a mass matrix multiplying a generalized velocity to give the kinetic term and a force matrix multiplying a displacement vector to characterize the interactions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the best way to obtain solutions is to determine the system's eigenvectors its normal modes by diagonalizing the matrix equation
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: techniques like this are crucial when it comes to the internal dynamics of molecules the internal vibrations of systems consisting of mutually bound component atoms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they are also needed for describing mechanical vibrations and oscillations in electrical circuits
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: geometrical optics provides further matrix applications
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in this approximative theory the wave nature of light is neglected
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the result is a model in which light rays are indeed geometrical rays
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: if the deflection of light rays by optical elements is small the action of a lens or reflective element on a given light ray can be expressed as multiplication of a two component vector with a two by two matrix called ray transfer matrix the vector's components are the light ray's slope and its distance from the optical axis while the matrix encodes the properties of the optical element
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: actually there are two kinds of matrices viz
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: a refraction matrix describing the refraction at a lens surface and a translation matrix describing the translation of the plane of reference to the next refracting surface where another refraction matrix applies
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the optical system consisting of a combination of lenses and or reflective elements is simply described by the matrix resulting from the product of the components matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: traditional mesh analysis in electronics leads to a system of linear equations that can be described with a matrix
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the behaviour of many electronic components can be described using matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: let a be a 2-dimensional vector with the component's input voltage v 1 and input current i 1 as its elements and let b be a 2-dimensional vector with the component's output voltage v 2 and output current i 2 as its elements
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: then the behaviour of the electronic component can be described by b = h · a where h is a 2 x 2 matrix containing one impedance element h 12 ), one admittance element h 21 ) and two dimensionless elements h 11 and h 22 ).
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: calculating a circuit now reduces to multiplying matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: matrices have a long history of application in solving linear equations
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the chinese text the nine chapters on the mathematical art jiu zhang suan shu from between 300 bc and ad 200 is the first example of the use of matrix methods to solve simultaneous equations including the concept of determinants over 1000 years before its publication by the japanese mathematician seki in 1683 and the german mathematician leibniz in 1693
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: cramer presented his rule in 1750
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: early matrix theory emphasized determinants more strongly than matrices and an independent matrix concept akin to the modern notion emerged only in 1858 with cayley's memoir on the theory of matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the term matrix latin for womb derived from —mother ) was coined by sylvester who understood a matrix as an object giving rise to a number of determinants today called minors that is to say determinants of smaller matrices that derive from the original one by removing columns and rows
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in a 1851 paper sylvester explains : i have in previous papers defined a matrix as a rectangular array of terms out of which different systems of determinants may be engendered as from the womb of a common parent
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the study of determinants sprang from several sources
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: number theoretical problems led gauss to relate coefficients of quadratic forms i.e expressions such as x 2 + xy − 2y 2 and linear maps in three dimensions to matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: eisenstein further developed these notions including the remark that in modern parlance matrix products are non commutative
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: cauchy was the first to prove general statements about determinants using as definition of the determinant of a matrix a = [a i,j ] the following replace the powers a j k by a jk in the polynomial where n denotes the product of the indicated terms
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: he also showed in 1829 that the eigenvalues of symmetric matrices are real
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: jacobi studied functional determinants later called jacobi determinants by sylvester which can be used to describe geometric transformations at a local or infinitesimal level see above kronecker's vorlesungen uber die theorie der determinanten and weierstrass zur determinantentheorie both published in 1903 first treated determinants axiomatically as opposed to previous more concrete approaches such as the mentioned formula of cauchy
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: at that point determinants were firmly established
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: many theorems were first established for small matrices only for example the cayley hamilton theorem was proved for 2x2 matrices by cayley in the aforementioned memoir and by hamilton for 4x4 matrices
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: frobenius working on bilinear forms generalized the theorem to all dimensions 1898
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: also at the end of the 19th century the gauss jordan elimination generalizing a special case now known as gauss elimination was established by jordan
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: in the early 20th century matrices attained a central role in linear algebra
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: partially due to their use in classification of the hypercomplex number systems of the previous century
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the inception of matrix mechanics by heisenberg born and jordan led to studying matrices with infinitely many rows and columns
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: later von neumann carried out the mathematical formulation of quantum mechanics by further developing functional analytic notions such as linear operators on hilbert spaces which very roughly speaking correspond to euclidean space but with an infinity of independent directions
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: the word has been used in unusual ways by at least two authors of historical importance
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: bertrand russell and alfred north whitehead in their principia mathematica 1910-1913 use the word matrix in the context of their axiom of reducibility
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: they proposed this axiom as a means to reduce any function to one of lower type successively so that at the bottom 0 order the function is identical to its extension :"let us give the name of matrix to any function of however many variables which does not involve any apparent variables
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: then any possible function other than a matrix is derived from a matrix by means of generalization i.e by considering the proposition which asserts that the function in question is true with all possible values or with some value of one of the arguments the other argument or arguments remaining undetermined
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: for example a function φ(x y of two variables x and y can be reduced to a collection of functions of a single variable e.g y by considering the function for all possible values of individuals a i substituted in place of variable x and then the resulting collection of functions of the single variable y i.e ∀a i : φ(a i y can be reduced to a matrix of values by considering the function for all possible values of individuals b i substituted in place of variable y :∀b j ∀a i : φ(a i b j ).alfred tarski in his 1946 introduction to logic used the word matrix synonymously with the notion of truth table as used in mathematical logic
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: වානිජ්‍ය දැන්වීම් මාධ්‍යයන් ලෙස බිත්තිවල අඳින ලද චිත්‍රමය දැන්වීම් wall paints බිල් බෝර්ඩ් රූප මුද්‍රිත වාහන ගුවන් විදුලිය සිනමාව රූපවාහිනී දැන්වීම් වෙබ් අඩවිවල දැන්වීම් ජංගම දුරකතන තිරයන් කඩසාප්පුවල භාණ්ඩ එහා මෙහා කිරීමට යොදන කරත්ත බස් නැවතුම්වල ආසන සඟරා පුවත්පත් නගර නිළ නිවේදකයින් බස්රථවල හෝ ගුවන් යානාවල දෙපැති logojets කුලීරථවල දොර මඟී තිර සංගීත වේදිකා ප්‍රදර්ශන දුම්රිය වේදිකා සුපිරි වෙළඳසැල්වල ඇති ඇපල් මත ස්ටිකර් ෆෝස්ටර් ටිකට්වල පිටුපස දැක්විය හැකිය වානිජ්‍ය දැන්වීම් මාධ්‍යයන් ලෙස බිත්තිවල අඳින ලද චිත්‍රමය දැන්වීම් wall paints බිල් බෝර්ඩ් රූප මුද්‍රිත වාහන ගුවන් විදුලිය සිනමාව රූපවාහිනී දැන්වීම් වෙබ් අඩවිවල දැන්වීම් ජංගම දුරකතන තිරයන් කඩසාප්පුවල භාණ්ඩ එහා මෙහා කිරීමට යොදන කරත්ත බස් නැවතුම්වල ආසන සඟරා පුවත්පත් නගර නිළ නිවේදකයින් බස්රථවල හෝ ගුවන් යානාවල දෙපැති logojets කුලීරථවල දොර මඟී තිර සංගීත වේදිකා ප්‍රදර්ශන දුම්රිය වේදිකා සුපිරි වෙළඳසැල්වල ඇති ඇපල් මත ස්ටිකර් ෆෝස්ටර් ටිකට්වල පිටුපස දැක්විය හැකිය

lines.value: කුඩා කල සිට පරිසරයේ ශබ්ද කුරුළු නාද මිනිස් හඩට සවන් දිමෙ රිද්මය හදුනාගෙන,සංකිර්ණ සංගිත භණ්ඩවල නඳරටා හදුනා ගැනිම දක්වා ස්වර සංයොජනය වාදනය ගයනය වැනි කුසලතා ඔස්සේ ගැඹුරට යමින් ස්වකිය බුද්ධිය වඩවා ගනියි.නි.ලෙස සංගිතඥයා සංගිතස්වර රචකයා ගයකයා වාදකයා,සංගිත ගුරුවරයා දැක්විය හැක.center|200px

lines.value: ඇමරිකාව,අප්‍රිකාව,ඉන්දියාව,පකිස්තානය,සහ ශ්‍රි ලංකාව වැනි රටවල උෂ්ණ කලාපිය ප්‍රදේශ ආශිතව සරැවට වැඩෙන කටු සහිත,දික් හැඩැති කොළ ඇති ශාක විශේෂයකි කෝමාරිකා.මෙය ලිලියාසේ liliaceae කුලයට අයත් ඇලෝ ඉන්ඩිකා(aloe indica යන උද්භිත විද්‍යාත්මක නමින් හැදින්වේ.මෙය ස්ත්‍රි පක්ෂයේ රෝග විශාල සංබ්‍යාවක් සුවකිරීමට යොදාගන්නා ඹෟෂධයක් බැවින් කුමාරි,ගෘහ කන්‍යා,කන්‍යා,සෘතු කුමාරි,කුමාරිකා ආදි විවිධ නම් වලින් හැදින්වේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: මිනිස් සිරුරට අවශ්‍යය ඇමයිනෝ අම්ල විසි දෙකකින් විස්සක්ම අඩංගුය.ශාරීරයට නිපදවාගත නොහැකි අත්‍යවශ්‍ය(essential protein ඇමයිනෝ වර්ග හතක්ම ඵහි අඩංගුය.අධිකපෝටීන ප්‍රමානයකින් සමන්විත වේ.මෙහි විටමින් ඵ් විටමින් ඊ විටමින් සි සහ විටමින් බි අඩංගුය.පැරැන්නෝ විටමින් ඵ් ඌනතාවය නිසා ඇතිවන රාත්‍රි අන්ධභාවය සඳහා ඹෟෂධයක් ලෙසින් මෙය භාවිතා කර ඇත.සමහර පිළිකා,රුධිරය තුළ ඇතිවන ප්‍රෝටීන ඌනතාවය වැළැක්වීමට පිළියමක් ලෙස කෝමාරිකා යුෂ වලින් සාදන පානයක් භාවිතා කළේය.රෝගියකු දරුණු ආබාධිත තත්වයනට පත්ව esr නමැති රුධිර පරීන්ෂණයේ ඉහල අගයක් ඇතිවිට ඵය ඉක්මනින් පහළ මට්ටමට ගෙන ඵ්මට කෝමාරිකා යුෂ භාවිතා කෙරේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: අක්ෂි රෝග ,පෝෂණ ඌනතා රෝග,රක්තහීනතාවය,දුර්වල ප්‍රතිශක්තියක් ඇතිවිට ඵය මර්ධනයට,ආමාශික තුවාල(gastritis අන්ත්‍රගත තුවාල(ulcrative colitis),ගුදය මගින් රක්තවහනය වීමෙදි(rectal bleeding අර්ශස්වලට සම්බන්ධ අන්ත්‍රගත පිළිකා,චර්ම පිළිකා,ලේ පිළිකා ආදියට,ඔසප් චක්‍රය ආශ්‍රිත විවිධ රෝග සඳහා,ආර්තව හරණය නිසා ඇතිවන රෝග,සුවනොවන තුවාල සුවකිරීමට,රූපලාවන්‍ය ප්‍රතිකාර,සම විකිරණ මඟින් ආරක්ෂාව,දියවැඩියා සහ උන්මාද රෝග ආදි විවිධ රෝග සඳහා ප්‍රතිඵලදායක ඖෂධයකි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: මෙහිදි කෝමාරිකා ඖෂධයක් ලෙස භාවිතා කිරීමෙදී ක්‍රම දෙකකින් ඵම පිළිකාව හෝ ගෙඩිය විනාශකර දමයි.ඵනම් කෝමාරිකා තුළ ඇති පොලිසැකරයිඩ සහ අල්කොලොයිඩි වලට ශාරිරය තුළ වෙනස්වු dna අණු මුල් ස්වරූපයට ගෙනඵ්මේ හැකියාව ඇත.මෙහි ප්‍රතිඵලයක් ලෙස 1.වෙනස්වු සෛල මුල් ස්වරූපයට ගෙන ඵ්ම නිසා පිළිකා සෛල ඇති නොවේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: 2.කෝමාරිකාවල ඇති අධික ප්‍රතිශක්තියක් ඇතිකරදීමේ හැකියාව නිසා t4 ලිම්පොසයිට් සහ භක්ෂක සෛල වැඩිපුර ඇතිකර වෛරසය විනාශකරන අතර වැඩි ප්‍රතිශක්තියක්ද ඇතිකරනු ලබයි.නිතර වැළදෙන රෝගාබාධවලින් ශාරීරය ආරක්ෂාකරදීම ඵමඟින් සිදුවේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: මෙම රෝගය සඳහා විවිධ ඖෂධ වර්ග දක්නට ලැබුනත් රෝගය සුවවන ආකාරයේ ගුණයක් නොලැබෙන බව නොරහසකි.ඵම රෝගී අවස්ථාව සඳහා කෝමාරිකා වටිනා ඖෂධයකි.අම්ල පිත්ත හෙවත් ආමාශයික ප්‍රදාහයේ දී gastritis ආමාශයික යුෂ ප්‍රමාණය ඉහල යාමක් සිදුවේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ආමාශය වටා ඇතුළතින් ඇති ආවරන පටලය(epithilium)ඉදිමේ.පසුව ඵය ආමාශයික තුවාල ඇතිවීම දක්වා වැඩිවේ.ඵවැන් අවස්ථාවක කෝමාරිකා ශාකයේ ඡෙලි වැනි කොටස බීමක් වශයෙන් ගත්විට ප්‍රත්‍යන්ෂ ලෙස සුවය ලැබේ.කෝමාරිකාවල ඇති සිසිලන ගුණය නිසා ආමාශයේ වේදනාව නැති කරනු ලැබේ.ඵහි ඇති හිරිවැටිමේ ගණය මඟින්(anasthatic ආමාශයේ වේදනාව තව දුරටත් අඩු කරනු ඇත
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ප්‍රදහ සමන ගුණය මඟින්(anti inflammationry ඉදිමුම අඩු කරයි.මෙහි ඇති ශාරීය ගුණය මඟින්ආමාශයේ ආම්ලික ගතිය නැතිකරයි.මෙහි ඇති විශේෂවු ඇල්කොලයිඩ මඟින් ගැස්ට්‍රිස් හෝමෝනය පාලනය කර ආමාශයික යුෂ වැඩිපුර ගලායාම සීමා කෙරේන ඵසේම සමහර ඇල්කොලයිඩ මඟින් මිනිස් මොළයේ සමහර ස්ථාන වෙත බලපෑමක් කර,මානසික සන්සුන් බව ඇත්කීරීමෙන් ආමාශයික යුෂ ගලාඵ්ම පාලනය කරයි.මෙහි අඩංගු සමහර පොලිසැකරයිඩ මඟින් ආමාශයේ අභ්‍යන්තර ආවරණ පටලය epithelium වේගයෙන් වර්ධනය කර තුවාල ඉක්මනින් සුව කරයි.මේ නිසා අම්ල පිත්ත රෝගයද නිට්ටාවට සුව කිරීමේ හැකියාව මෙම ඖෂධයට පවතී
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ප්‍රධාන හේතුව වේ.මේ නිසා ශාරීරයේ ඇතිවන දැවිල්ල ඇඟපත වේදනාව,ශාරීරයේ ගින්දර පිටවෙන්නාසේ දැනීම,නින්ද නොයාම ආදි විවිධ රෝග වලට ගොදුරු වේ.මෙයට ප්‍රතිකාරයක් ලෙස කෝමාරිකා භාවිතයට ගනී.කෝමාරිකාවල අඩංගු ඊස්ට්‍රඡන්(oestrogen වලට සමාන රසායනික ව්‍යුහයක් ඇති ඇල්කොලොයිඩ මඟින් ඊස්ට්‍රඡන් හෝමෝනයේ අඩුව පිරිමසයි.මේ නිසා ඵවැනි ස්ත්‍රීන්ට කෝමාරිකා පානයක් වශයෙන් භාවිතය වඩාත් සුදුසු වේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: ඵමඟින් ශරීරයේ කළු පැහැති ස්වභාවය ඉවත්කර දීප්තිමත් සුදු පැහැති සමක් ලබා දෙයි.මෙම ඖෂධීය ගුණය නිසා රූප ස්වභාවය වැඩි දියුණු කරගත හැකිය.තවද දිනපතා කෝමාරික යුෂ සමමත ආලේප කිරීමේන් අධික සුර්යයාලෝකයෙන් මෘදු සම ආරක්ෂා කිරීම සිදුවේ.කෝමාරිකා යුෂ මඟින් සම තුළට විකිරණ ඇතුලුවීම වළකාලන අතර,සමට ආරක්ෂක පටලයක් ලෙස ක්‍රියා කිරීමද සිදුවේ.කෝමාරිකා වලට ආවරණ පටල epithelium වේගයෙන් වර්ධනය කිරීමේ හැකියාව ඇති නිසා සම මතුපිට ඇතිවන සීරීම් ඉක්මනින් සුවකර දී,කැළැල් ද නැති කිරීමේ හැකියාව පවතී.කෝමාරිකා යුෂ ෂැම්පු ඵකක් වශයෙන්ද භාවිතයට ගැනීමෙන් හිස් හොරි,හිසේ ඇතිවන තුවාල සුවපත් කරගත හැකිය
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: තම්බාගත් උළුහාල් ස්වල්පයකට කෝමාරිකා මදය ස්වල්පයක් කලවම්කර,හොදින් ම්ශ්‍රකර ගැනීමෙන් සෙවල සහිත ද්‍රාවනයක් සෑදේ.ඵය නෑමට පැයකට පෙර හිසගල්වන්න.මේ තුළින් හිස්හොරි,හිසේ තුවාල සුවවේ.තවද විටමින් e නිසා හිසකෙස් වර්ධනය සිදුවේ.හොද පෝෂණයක්ද ලැබේ

lines.value: ක්ලිනර් බර්ග් යන රුසියන් මහාචාර්යවරයා සහ තවත් රුසියන් සත්ත්ව විද්‍යා ආචාර්ය වරුන් දෙදෙනෙකු වූ v.බෙල්කොවිච් සහ a සැබ්කෝව් යන අය විසින් සමුද්‍රයේ ගුප්ත සතා යනුවෙන් ඩොල්පින් පිළිබඳව ඉතාවැදගත් කරුණු ඇතුලත් ග්‍රන්ථයක් මීට වසර කිහිපයකට පෙර පලකරන ලදී

lines.value: ජනගහනය වියපත් වීම population ageing යනු ජන සංඛ්‍යාවක වයස්ගතවූවන්ගේ ප්‍රතිශතය මුළු ජන සංඛ්‍යාවට සාපේක්‍ෂව ක්‍රමයෙන් ඉහළයාමයි."සංවර්ධිත රටවල වියපත් ජන‍ගහනය ‍‍ ‍ලෙස සැලකෙන්නේ වයස අවුරැදු 65 හෝ ඊට වැඩි ජනගහනයයි.නමුත් සංවර්ධනය වෙමින් පවතින රටවල වයස අවුරැදු 60 හෝ ඊට වැඩි පිරිස වියපත් ජනගහන‍ය ලෙස සලකයි.වියපත්වීම සංවර්ධන‍ය වෙමින් පවතින රටවලට පමණක් නොව සංවර්ධිත රටවලටද විවිධ බලපෑම් ඇති කර‍යි

lines.value: නමුත් මෙම තත්ත්වය දැනට ශ්‍රී ලංකාවේ නොමැත.ඒඩ්ස් රෝගය පැතිරීම වැලැක්වීමේ විශේෂ ඒකකයට ලැබී ඇති දත්ත අනුව 2007 මැයි වන විට hiv ආසාදිතයන් 872ක් හදුනාගෙන තිබේ

lines.value: වයස් පරතරය අනුව ස්ත්‍රි පුරුෂ රෝග ව්‍යාප්තිය සිදු වනුයේ වයස අවුරුදු 0-9ත් අතර ස්ත්‍රී 04කුත් පුරුෂ 10කුත් වයස අවුරුදු 10-19ත් අතර ස්ත්‍රී 01කුත් පුරුෂ 02කුත් අවුරුදු 20ත් 29ත් අතර කාලය තුල ස්ත්‍රී 54කුත් පුරුෂ 59කුත් වයස 30-39දී ස්ත්‍රී 108කුත් පුරුෂ 136 දෙනෙක්ද 40ත් 49 අතර වයස් වලදී ස්ත්‍රී 53කුත් පුරුෂ 95කුත් වයස අවුරුදු 50ට වැඩි අවස්ථාවේදී ස්ත්‍රී 13කුත් පුරුෂ 32කුත් වයස් පරතරය අනුව hiv ආසාදනයට ගොදුරු වී ඇත.2007 මැයි මාසය වන විට hiv ආසාදිතයන් 872ක් සොයා ගෙන තිබුණු අතර එයින් 220 දෙනෙකුට ඒඩ්ස් රෝගය වැළදී තිබුණි
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: 2007 වසරේ පලමු මාස 03 අවසානයේ දී hiv ආසාදිතයන් 24දෙනෙකු සොයාගෙන ඇති අතර රෝගීන් 112 සදහා මේ වන විට සෞඛ්‍ය අමාත්‍යාංශයෙන් නොමිලේ සායන පවත්වා අවශ්‍ය ප්‍රතිකාර සහ දැණුවත් කිරීමේ වැඩසටහන් ක්‍රියාත්මක කරනු ලබයි

lines.value: අනියම් ලිංගික සම්බන්ධතා අවම මට්ටමක පැවතීම ඉතාමත් ඉහල ගුණාත්මක සෞඛ්‍ය පහසුකම් තිබීම සමාජ රෝග පැතිරීම වැළැක්වීමේ විශේෂ ඒකකයක් පිහිටු වීම ශ්‍රී ලංකාව තුල සමාජ රෝග සම්බන්ධයෙන් දැනුවත් කිරීමේ විශේෂ වැඩසටහන් ක්‍රියාත්මක කිරීමත් ශ්‍රී ලංකාවේ ස්ත්‍රිය සදහා උසස් සමාජ පිළිගැනීමක් හා ගෞරවයක් හිමිවීම ආදී හේතූන් මත hiv ආසාදනය වීම හෝ ඒඩ්ස් රෝගය පැතිර යාම අවම මට්ටමක පැවතීමට පුබල බලපෑමක් එල්ලකරනු ලබයි

lines.value: පිටි මාංශ උපයෝගී කොට ගෙන හම් වැනි ස්ථර තැනීමේ ක‍්‍රියාවලියෙහි දුෂ්කර භාවය පරාතා පිළියෙල කිරීම අපහසු කටයුත්තක් බවට පෙරලයි මෙම කරුණ නිසා මෙන්ම මෙම පැතලිපාන් වර්ගයෙහි අතිශය ජනප්‍රියතාවය නිසාවෙන්ද ශීතකල පරාතා විවිධ මාදිලියන් අද වෙළෙඳ පොලෙහි දක්නට ඇත වෙසෙසින්ම බටහිර වෙළෙඳපොලෙහි දක්නට ලැබෙන ප්‍රවණතාවයක් වන මෙය පාරිභෝගිකයන් තදින් බලාපොරොත්තු වන අව්‍යාජත්වය හා මූලික අමුද්‍රව්‍ය වලින් පරාතාවක් සදා ගැනීමට ඔවුනට කාලය නොමැති වීම යන කරුණු ද්වයය පදනම් කරගෙන පෝෂණය වන බව පෙනේ

lines.value: <div class=text>1938 දී පුරා විද්යාළඥයෙකු වන චයි පූ තෙයි(chi pu tei)විසින් ටිබෙට් දේශ ශීමාවේ පිහිටි බයියන් කාරා උලා කඳු නිම්නයේ අද්භූත ආකාරයෙන් පිහිටා ඇති ගල්ගුහා කිහිපයක් සොයා ගත්තේය.සමහර ගල් ගුහා තුළ සිතුවම් දක්නට ලැබිණ

lines.value: <div class=text> එම ගුහා තුළින්ම ශබ්ද පටිගත කරන තැටියක හැඩය ඇති සංඥා පුවරුවක් 1962 දී විමර්ශනයට ලක් කල මහාචාර්යය සුම් උම් නුයි sum um nui එහි සඳහන් කරුණු පරිවර්ථනය කිරීමට සමත් වූවේය.එහි අඩංගු වූයේ මීට අවුරුදු 12000 කට පෙර යම් ඡීවී කණ්ඩායමක් ඔවුන්ගේ යානයේ වූ දෝශයක් නිසා මෙම සෞරග්‍රහ මණ්ඩලයේ තෙවන ග්‍රහලෝකයට ගොඩබැස්ස බවය.ඔවුන්ගේ යානය ප්රයතිසංස්කරණය කළ නොහැකි වූ බැවින් අසල කඳු වල ඡීවත් වූ ගෝත්රිඔක කණ්ඩායම් සමග මිත්රි වීමට මෙම ඡීවීන් උත්සාහ කොට තිබේ.නමුත් මෙම ඡීවීන් තුලින් දිස්වූ මානව නොවන ස්වරූපය නිසා මොවුන්ව ගෝත්රිසකයන් විසින් මරා දමා තිබේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: 1969 පළව එරික් වොන් ඩැනිකන් නම් ග්‍රන්ථ කතුවරයාගේ chariots of gods"නම් කෘතිය තුළ ඊඡිප්තුවේ පිරමීඩ,එංගලන්තයේ ස්ටෝන් හෙන්ඡ් stone henge ) නම් පාෂාණ ,ඇමරිකා එක්සත් ඡනපදාය් මෙසා පර්වතය,ඊස්ටන් දිවයිනේ ගල් ප්ර්තිමා ඇතුළු තවත් ස්ථාන කිහිපයක් පෘථිවි මිනිසා පිටසක්වළ ඡීවීන් සමග සම්බන්ධතා පැවැත්වීම සම්බන්ධයෙන් සාක්ෂි දරන බව පැවසේ
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: පිරමීඩ <div class=text>පුදුම හතෙන් එකක් වන පිරමීඩ පිළිබඳ තවමත් ඇත්තේ අභිරහසකි.ඊඡිප්තුව පුරා විශාල වියලි බිම් පරාසයක විහිදෙන මේ පිරමීඩ හුදෙක් මියගිය ඊඡිප්තු රඡුන්ගේ සොහොන් කොත් ලෙස හෝ ස්මාරක ලෙස හෝ පමණක් සැලකීම දුෂ්කරය.තාක්ෂණය නොදියුණු යුගයක,මිණුම් ක්රුම පිළිබඳ පැහැදිලි අවබෝධයක් නොවූ යුගයක මෙම නිර්මාණ තැනීමේ ආභාෂය ඔවුන් ලද්දේ කෙසේද?මේ සඳහා විශ්වයේ වෙනත් ග්රයහලෝකයක උදව් ඔවුන්ට ලැබුණාද
lines.name: Sinhalese

lines.value: <div class=text>වර්ෂ 1864 දී චාල්ස් ස්මිත් නම් ස්කොට්ලන්ත ඡාතික තාරකා විද්යා ඥයා විසින් රචිත විස්මිත පිරමීඩයන්හි අපේ උරුමය"(our inheritance in the great pyramid)නම් ග්‍රන්ථයේ පිරමීඩ තැනීමේදී යොදාගෙන ඇති ඒකක ක්‍රමය පිළිබඳ සාකච්ඡා කරයි.ඔහු මෙම ඒකකය පිරමීඩ අඟල්"(pyramid inch)ලෙස හඳුන්වයි.මෙම පිරමීඩ අඟලක් බ්‍රිතාන්‍ය මෙට්රිික් ඒකක ක්‍රමයේ අඟල් 1.00099 ට සමානය.මෙසේ අධික නිරවද්යමතාවයකින් යුතු මිනිත ක්රබම භාවිත කිරීමේ හැකියාව ආදී වැසියන්ට ලැබුනේ කෙසේද
